src_text: but much more than that, these rights are essential to the success of our national and collective struggle to overcome the coronavirus.
tgt_text: xidemokirasi xa hina xi ta hi pfuna ku hlula covid 19 vukuzenzele unnamed hi mikarhi yotala hi tekela xidemokirasi xa hina lexi hanyeke kahle no ntlhontlha miehleketo ehansi.

src_text: sa moves to alert level 3 vukuzenzele unnamed president cyril rama phosa has announced that south africa has moved to level 3 with effect from 1 june with more sectors of the economy opening and the removal of a number of restrictions on the movement of people.
tgt_text: afrikadzonga yi ya eka levhele yavulemukisi ya 3 vukuzenzele unnamed phuresidente cyril ramaphosa u tivisile leswaku afrikadzonga yi sukile yi ya eka levhele ya vulemukisi ya 3 kusukela hi 1 khotavuxika – laha ku nga na tisekitara to tala ta ikhonomi ti pfulaka na ku susiwa ka swipimelo swo hlayanyana eka ku fa mbafamba ka vanhu.

src_text: addressing the nation re cently on the developments in south africa’s riskadjusted strategy to manage the spread of the coronavirus (covid19), the president says the country will have a differentiated approach to deal with areas that have far higher levels of infection and transmission.
tgt_text: loko a vulavurisana na rixaka ku nga ri khale a tivisa tiko hi leswi nga ku humeleleni eka qhinga leri fambelanisiweke na nxungeto ra afrikadzonga ku lawula ku hangalaka ka khoronavhayirasi (covid19), phuresidente u vula leswaku tiko ri ta va na endlelo ro hambanisiwa ku tirhana na tindhawu leti ti nga na tilevhele ta le henhla swinene ta ntluletavuvabyi na hundziselo.

src_text: covid19 hotspotsthese areas have been de clared as coronavirus disease hotspots.
tgt_text: tindhawu ta nghozi ta covid19tindhawu leti ti tivisiwile tanihi tindhawu ta nghozi ta vuvabyi bya khoronavhayirasi.

src_text: they include the following metros: city of tshwane city of johannesburg ekurhuleni ethekwini nelson mandela bay buffalo city cape town.
tgt_text: ti katsa madorobakulu lama landzelaka: dorobakulu ra tshwane dorobakulu ra joni ekurhuleni ethekwini nelson mandela bay dorobakulu ra buffalo kapa.

src_text: other areas that have been identified as hotspots are the west coast, overberg and cape winelands district municipalities in the western cape, chris hani district in the eastern cape and ilembe district in kwazulunatal.
tgt_text: tindhawu tin'wana leti nga kumeka ti ri ta nghozi i timasipala ta west coast, overberg na xifundzatsongo xa cape winelands ekapavupeladya mbu, xifundzatsongo xa chris hani ekapavuhumadyambu, na xifundzatsongo xa ilembe ekwazulunatal.

src_text: a hotspot is defined as an area that has more than five infected people per every 100 000 people or where new infections are increasing at a fast pace.
tgt_text: ndhawu ya nghozi yi hlamuseriwa tanihi ndhawu leyi nga na kutlula ntlhanu wa tiphesente ta vanhu lava tluleriweke hi vuvabyi eka 100 000 ya vanhu kumbe laha mitluletavuvabyi yintshwa yi tlakukaka hi ku hatlisa.

src_text: to deal with the virus in these areas, government will implement intensive interventions aimed at decreasing the number of new infections.
tgt_text: ku tirhana na xitsongwatsongwana etindhawini leti, mfumo wu fanele ku simeka miphalalo ya le henhla leyi nga kongomisiwa eka ku hunguta nhlayo ya mitluletavuvabyi yintshwa.

src_text: "we are putting in place enhanced measures of surveillance, infection control and management.
tgt_text: "hi le ku simekeni ka magoza yo antswisiwa yo langutisisa, vulawuri bya mitluletavuvabyi na malawulelo.

src_text: we will assign a fulltime team of experienced personnel to each hotspot," the president says.
tgt_text: hi ta veka xipano xa nkarhi hinkwawo wa vatirhi va ntokoto eka ndhawu ya nghozi yin'wana na yin'wana," ku vula phuresidente.

src_text: this team will include epidemiologists, family practition ers, nurses, community health workers, public health experts and emergency medical services, to be supported by cuban experts.
tgt_text: xipano lexi xi ta katsa ti epidemiyolojisi, vatirhi va swa mindyangu, vaongori, vatirhi va swa rihanyo va le miga ngeni, vativinkulu va swa riha nyo ra vaaki na vukorhokeri bya swa vutshunguri bya xilamulelamhangu xa rihanyo, hi ku seketeriwa hi vativinkulu va le cuba.

src_text: "we will link each hotspot to testing services, isolation facilities, quarantine facilities, treatment, hospital beds and contact tracing.
tgt_text: "hi ta hlanganisa ndhawu ya nghozi yin'wana na yin'wana na vukorhokeri byo kambela, miako ya nhlambulo, miako yo tiveka wexe, vutshunguri, mibedo ya xibedhlele na ku landzelerisa ku hlangana.

src_text: "should it be necessary, any part of the country could be returned to alert levels 4 or 5 if the spread of infection is not contained despite our interventions and there is a risk of our health facilities being overwhelmed," he says.
tgt_text: "loko swi fanerile, xiphemu xihi kumbe xihi xi nga tlheriseriwa eka tilevhele ta vule mukisi ta 4 kumbe 5 loko ku hangalaka ka ntluletavuvabyi swi nga lawuleki hambiloko ku ri na miphalalo ya hina naswona ku ri na nxungeto wo tala eka miako ya hina ya swa rihanyu," a vula.

src_text: the list of hotspot areas will be reviewed every two weeks depending on the progression of the virus.
tgt_text: nongoloko wa tindhawu ta nghozi wu ta langutisisiwa endzhaku ka mavhiki mambirhi man'wana na man'wana ku ya hi ku hangalaka ka xitsongwa tsongwana lexi.

src_text: opening the economythe implementation of alert level 3 which started at the beginning of june, involved the return to operation of most sectors of the econo my, subject to observance of strict health protocols and social distancing rules.
tgt_text: ku pfula ikhonomiku simekiwa ka levhele ya vulemukisi ya 3 leyi sunguleke emasungulweni ya khotavuxika, swi khumbe ku vuyela eku tirheni ka tisekitara to tala ta ikhonomi, ti languteriwa ku landzelela milawu yo tika ya swa rihanyo na ya ku siya mpfhukanyana exikarhi va nhu.

src_text: more public servants have also returned to work in accordance with provisions of the occupational health and safety act and as guided by the department of public service and administration, working together with all other departments in government.
tgt_text: vatirhelamfumo vo tala va vuyerile emitirhweni hi ku fambisana na milulamiselo ya nawu wa rihanyo na vuhla yiseki bya le ntirhweni na hi ku leteriwa hi ndzawulo ya vatirhelamfumo na vulawuri, hi ku tirhisana na tindzawulo letin'wana hinkwato leti nga eka mfumo.

src_text: protocols and workplace plansas more sectors of the econ omy open, government will rely on social compacts with all key role players to address the key risk factors at the workplace and in the interface between employees and the public.
tgt_text: milawu na tipulani ta ndhawu ya ntirhotanihiloko tisekitara to tala ta ikhonomi ti pfula, mfumo wu ta tshembela eka mitwanano ya vaaki na vatirhinkulu hinkwavo ku lulamisa hi swivangelokulu swa nxu ngeto eka ndhawu ya ntirho na ku hlangana exikarhi ka vatirhi na vaaki.

src_text: "we will therefore be finalising a number of sector protocols and will require every company to develop a workplace plan before they reopen," he says.
tgt_text: "hikokwalaho hi ta va hi karhi hi hetisisa milawu yo hlayanyana ya tisekitara naswona hi ta lava khamphani yin'wana na yin'wana ku tumbuluxa pulani ya ndhawu ya ntirho va nga si pfula nakambe," a vula.

src_text: according to these plans, companies will need to put in place sanitary and social distancing measures and facilities; they will need to screen workers on arrival each day, quarantine those who may be infected and make arrangements for them to be tested.
tgt_text: hi ku ya hi tipulani leti, tikhamphani ti ta dinga ku simeka magoza ya mbhasiso na ku siya mpfhuka nyana exikarhi ka vanhu na switirhisiwa; va ta dinga ku hlahluva vatirhi loko va fika siku na siku, ku hlambu la lava va nga vaka va tluleriwile hi vuvabyi na ku va lulamisela ku kambe riwa.

src_text: "they also need to assist with contact tracing if employees test positive.
tgt_text: "va dinga ku pfuna hi ku lava lava va hlanganeke na vona loko vatirhi va kambe riwile va kumeka va ri na yona.

src_text: because of their vulnerability, all staff who are older than 60 years of age and those who suffer from underlying conditions such as heart disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease and cancer should ideally stay at home," the president says.
tgt_text: hikokwalaho ka ku nga sirhelelekangi, vatirhi hikwavo lava va nga na malembe ya le henhla ka 60 hi vukhale na lava va nga na mavabyi yo godzombela yo fana na vuvabyi bya mbilu, vuvabyi bya chukela, vuvabyi byo godzombela byo hefemula na mfukuzana va fanele ku tshama ekaya," ku vula phuresidente.

src_text: employees who can work from home should be allowed to do so.
tgt_text: vatirhi lava va kotaka ku tirhela emakaya va fanele ku pfumeleriwa ku endla tano.

src_text: subject to these measures, all manufacturing, mining, construction, financial services, professional and business services, information technology, com munications, government services and media services, reopened from 1 june.
tgt_text: hi ku ya hi magoza lama, vuhumelerisi hinkwabyo, vucelamigodi, vumaki, vukorhokeri bya swa timali, vukorhokeri bya xiphurofexinali na bya mabindzu, thekinoloji ya mahungu, vuhlanganisi, vukorhokeri bya mfumo na vukorhokeri bya swihangalasamahu ngu, swi ta pfuriwa kusuke la hi 1 khotavuxika.

src_text: the appropriate restart and phasing in arrangements will need to be put in place for every workplace.
tgt_text: ku su ngurisa hi vuntshwa loku faneleke na malulamiselo ya swiphemuphemu swi ta dinga ku simekiwa eka ndhawu yin'wana na yin'wana ya ntirho.

src_text: "wholesale and retail trade will be fully opened, including stores, spaza shops and informal traders.
tgt_text: "tiholisele na nxaviselo wa vanhu swi ta pfuriwa hi ku hetiseka, ku katsa switolo, mavhengelexiphaza na vaxavisi vo ka va nga ri va ximfumo.

src_text: ecommerce will continue to remain open.
tgt_text: mabindzu ya xielekitironiki ya ta ya emahlweni yi tshama yi pfurile.

src_text: other sectors that opened previous ly, such as agriculture and forestry, utilities, medical services, food production and manufacture of hygiene products, will remain fully opened," he says.
tgt_text: tisekitara tin'wana leti a ti pfuriwile eka nkarhi lowu nga hundza, ku fana na vurimi na swihlahla, vukorhokeri bya gezi na mati, vukorhokeri bya swa vu tshunguri, ku endla swakudya na ku endla swimakiwa swa nsivelamavabyi, swi ta tshama swi pfuriwile hi ku hetiseka," a vula.

src_text: highrisk economic activities prohibitedhighrisk economic activi ties will remain prohibited.
tgt_text: migingiriko ya xiikho nomi ya nxungeto wa le henhla a yi pfumeleriwimigingiriko ya xiikhonomi ya nxungeto wa le henhla yi tshama ya ha tshimbisiwile.

src_text: these include: restaurants, bars and taverns, except for delivery or collection of food.
tgt_text: leswi swi katsa leswi landzelaka: mavhengele yo xavisa swakudya swo swekiwa, tibara na tithavhene, handle ka ku heleketa kumbe ku teka swakudya.

src_text: accommodation and domestic air travel, except for business travel, which will be phased in on dates to be announced.
tgt_text: vurhurhelo na tendzo to haha ta laha tikweni, handle ka tendzo ta bindzu, leti ti nga ta va kona eka masiku lama nga ta tivisiwa.

src_text: conferences, events, entertainment and sporting activities.
tgt_text: tikhomferense, swi endleko migingiriko yo hu ngasa na swa mitlangu .

src_text: personal care services, including hairdressing and beauty services.
tgt_text: vukorhokeri byo tihla yisa, ku katsa swa mi sisi na vukorhokeri byo sasekisa.

src_text: movement of people and sale of alcoholpeople will be able to exer cise at any time during the day, provided this is not done in groups.
tgt_text: ku fambafamba ka vanhu na ku xavisiwa ka byalwavanhu va ta kota ku tiolola nkarhi wun'wana na wun'wana esikwini, ntsenaloko leswi swi nga endliwi hi mitlawa.

src_text: the curfew on the movement of people will be lifted.
tgt_text: xinawana xo tshimbisa ku fambafamba ka vanhu xi ta susiwa.

src_text: "alcohol may be sold for home consumption only under strict conditions, on specified days and for limited hours.
tgt_text: "xihoko xi nga xavisiwa ku ya nwela ekaya ehansi ka swipimelo swo tika, hi masiku lama vekiweke naswona ku ringana ti awara leti pimiweke.

src_text: announcements in this regard will be made once we have concluded discussions with the sector on the various conditions," the president says.
tgt_text: switi viso eka mhaka leyi swi ta nyikiwa loko hi hetisisile mikanelo na sekitara leyi hi swipimelo swo hamba nahambana," ku vula phu residente.

src_text: the sale of tobacco products will remain prohibited in alert level 3, due to the health risks associated with smoking.
tgt_text: ku xavisiwa ka swimakiwa swa fole swi ta tshama swi tshimbisiwile eka le vhele ya vulemukisi ya 3, hikwalaho ka mixungeto ya rihanyo leyi fambelanaka na ku dzaha.

src_text: "all gatherings will remain prohibited, except for funerals with no more than 50 people or meetings in the workplace for work purposes," he says.
tgt_text: "tinhlengeletano ti ta tshama ta ha tshimbisiwile, handle ka mikosi leyi vaka na vanhu vo ka va nga hundzi 50 kumbe tinhlengeletano endhawini ya ntirho eka swiko ngomelo swa ntirho," a vula.

src_text: expect rise in infectionspresident ramaphosa says, in preparation for the expected increase in covid19 infections in the country, around 20 000 hospital beds have been, and are being, repurposed for covid19 cases, and 27 field hospitals are being built around the country.
tgt_text: langutelani ku tlaku ka eka mitluletavuva byi phuresidente ramaphosa u vula leswaku, hi ku lulamisela ntlakuko lowu languteriweke eka mitluletavuvabyi ya covid19 etikweni, kwalomu ka 20 000 wa mibedo ya swibe dhlele yi, naswona yi le ku tirhisiweni nakambe eka timhangu ta covid19, na 27 wa swibedhlele swa nkarhinyana swi le ku aki weni etikweni.

src_text: "a number of these hospitals are ready to receive coronavirus patients."
tgt_text: "swin'wana swa swibe dhlele leswi swi lulamerile ku amukela vavabyi va khoronavhayirasi."

src_text: the president says government appreciates the work that continues to be done by public servants, especially those in the front line in the fight against covid19.
tgt_text: phuresidente u vula leswaku mfumo wu amukela ntirho lowu wu yaka emahlweni wu endliwa hi vatirhelamfumo, ngopfungopfu lava va nga rhanga emahlweni eka ku lwisana na covid19.

src_text: "the safety of all workers, including public servants, is a matter of concern to us.
tgt_text: "vuhlayiseki bya vati rhi hinkwavo, ku katsa vatirhelamfumo, i mhaka yo vilerisa eka hina.

src_text: we will continue to make all efforts for the adequate provision of personal protection equipment to ensure safety for everyone while at work.
tgt_text: hi ta ya emahlweni hi endla matshalatshala hinkwawo ku nyika switirhisiwa swa nsirhelelo wa munhu yena n’wini ku tiyisisa vuhlayi seki bya vanhu hinkwavo loko va ri entirhweni.

src_text: "our priority is to reduce the opportunities for the transmission of the virus and create a safe environment for everyone," he says.
tgt_text: "lexi xi rhangaka ema hlweni eka hina i ku hu nguta swivandlanene swa ntluleto wa xitsongwa tsongwana na ku tumbuluxa mbangu wo hlayiseka wa vanhu hinkwavo," a vula.

src_text: tips to follow to avoid being infected by the coronavirus disease.
tgt_text: switsundzuxo leswi faneleke ku landzeleriwa ku sivela ku tluleriwa hi vuvabyi bya khoronavhayirasi.

src_text: »stay at home as much as you can.
tgt_text: »tshama ekaya swinene hilaha u kotaka hakona.

src_text: »remember to social distance.
tgt_text: »tsundzuka ku siya mpfhukanyana exikarhi ka vanhu »ambala xipfalaxikandza xa wena »hlamba swandla swa wena hi xisibi hi ku hetiseka.

src_text: »wear your face mask.
tgt_text: hlamba endzhaku ka swandla swa wena, exikarhi ka tintiho na le hansi ka min’wala.

src_text: »wash your hands with soap thoroughly.
tgt_text: hlamba swandla swa wena hi xisibi nkarhi hinkwawo loko u nga si dya na le ndzhaku ka loko u humile u ya eka ndhawu ya mani na mani.

src_text: wash the back of your hands, between the fingers and under the nails.
tgt_text: »khubumeta nomu wa wena hi thixu loko u khohlola na ku entshemula.

src_text: always wash your hands with soap before you eat and after being out in public.
tgt_text: papalata ku khoma xikandza hi swandla swo thyaka mikarhi hinkwayo.

src_text: »cover your mouth with a tissue paper when you cough and sneeze.
tgt_text: loko u fanerile, tiyisisa leswaku u hlamba swandla swa wena hi xisibi hi ku hetiseka kusungula.

src_text: avoid touching your face with dirty hands at all times.
tgt_text: »lava mpfuno wa swa vutshunguri loko u nga titwi kahle.

src_text: »seek medical help if you feel unwell.
tgt_text: swikombeto swa ntolovelo swa covid19 emirini swi katsa ku khohlola, ku huma marhimila, ku hisa miri na ku heleriwa hi moya.

src_text: typical symptoms of covid19 include coughing, runny nose, fever and shortness of breath.
tgt_text: loko u ri na xin'wana xa swikombeto leswi, lava mpfuno wa swa vutshunguri hi ku hatlisa.

src_text: if you are experiencing any of these symptoms, seek medical attention promptly.

tgt_text: afrikadzonga yi ya eka levhele yavulemukisi ya 3 vukuzenzele unnamed phuresidente cyril ramaphosa u tivisile leswaku afrikadzonga yi sukile yi ya eka levhele ya vulemukisi ya 3 kusukela hi 1 khotavuxika – laha ku nga na tisekitara to tala ta ikhonomi ti pfulaka na ku susiwa ka swipimelo swo hlayanyana eka ku fa mbafamba ka vanhu.

src_text: sa youth are a source of inspiration and hope vukuzenzele unnamed the words of frantz fanon that ‘each generation must discover its mission’ come to mind every time i have an opportunity to speak with young south africans.
tgt_text: vantshwa va afrikadzonga hi vona xihlovo xa nhlohlotelo na ku tshembha vukuzenzele unnamed hi marito ya frantz fanon ya ku ‘rixaka rin’wana na rin’wana ri fanele ku kuma xikongomelo xa rona’ ya ta emianakanyweni mikarhi hinkwawo loko ndzi lava ku vulavula na vantshwa va afrikadzonga.

src_text: no matter where they live and no matter what they do, they each have a burning desire to change the world.
tgt_text: swi nga ri na mhaka ku ri vatshama kwihi naswona va endla yini, hinkwavo va na ku hisekela lokukulu ku lava ku cinca misava.

src_text: while they certainly want to improve their own lives, they also want to achieve a better society and a better world.
tgt_text: loko hala tlhelo valava ku antswisa vutomi bya vona hikanene, vatlhela va lava ku ﬁ kelela ku va vaaki va kahle na misava yo antswa.

src_text: they see themselves as agents for fundamental transformation.
tgt_text: va ti vona va ri vona varhumiwa va ku tisa ku cinca ko vonakala.

src_text: throughout history young people have been a driving force for change.
tgt_text: eka matimu hinkwawo, vantshwa hi vona va nga tisa ku cinca.

src_text: in just the last few decades, young people have waged numerous struggles against injustice, from the 1968 student uprising in paris, to the antiwar movement in the united states in the 1960s, to the anticolonial struggle in many african and asian countries, to the fight against apartheid, to the arab spring.
tgt_text: eka malembekhume lawa ya hundza, vantshwa vohlaya va lwile tinyimpi tohlaya ehenhla ka vululami, ku sukela hi 1968 hi pfukelano wa machudeni eparis, ku ya eka nhlangano wo lwisana na nyimpi eamerica hi malembe ya va 1960, ku ya eka ku lwisana ka xikoloni eka matiko yo tala eafrika na le matikweni ya asia, na le ku lwisaneni ka xihlawuhlawu, na ku pfukelana ka arab spring.

src_text: most recently, young people have been at the forefront of the #blacklivesmatter movement that has gained global support in the wake of the killing of george floyd in the united states.
tgt_text: eka nkarhinyana lowu hi nga ka wona, vantshwa hi vona va nga emahlweni ka mpfhumba ra #blacklivesmatter leri nga kuma nseketelo wa misava endzhaku ka ku dlawa ka george floyd eamerika.

src_text: over the past few weeks, activists around the world have also been demanding the removal of symbols that glorify the barbarity and violence of the slave trade and colonialism.
tgt_text: eka mavhikinyana lawa ya nga hundza, vagingiriki emisaveni hinkwayo a va ri ku koxeni ka ku susiwa ka swikombo swa ku kurisa tihanyi na madzolonga ya ku xavisiwa ka mahlonga na vukoloni.

src_text: at an oxford university demonstration recently a protestor carried a placard with the words ‘rhodes must fall’, the rallying cry of students in our own country five years ago.
tgt_text: eka yunivhesiti ya oxford mukombisa ku vilela a khomile pulakhadi leyi a yi ri na marito ya ku ‘rhodes must fall’, lexi a ku ri xirilo xa machudeni ya hina eka malembe ya ntlhanu lawa ya hundzeke.

src_text: young people across the world have found common cause.
tgt_text: vantshwa emisaveni hinkwayo vakumile leswi fanaka leswi va nga swi lwelaku.

src_text: they are tearing down statues and symbols of racism, demanding the decolonisation of educational curricula, and calling for institutions to address racism and social exclusion.
tgt_text: va le ku wiseni ka swifaniso na swikombiso swa rivengo ra mbala, vakoxa ku herisiwa ka dyondzo leyi nga ni kharikhulamu ya xikoloni, na ku koxa mihlangano ku lulamisa timhaka ta xihlawuhlawu na ku kahlanganelo wa vanhu.

src_text: and so, as we paid tribute to the generation of 1976 on 16 june 2020, we also salute the youth of postapartheid south africa, the worthy inheritors of this noble legacy.
tgt_text: kutani, loko ha ha xixima rixaka ra 1976 hi ti 16 khotavuxika 2020, hi tlhela hi hlonipha vantshwa va ku hundza ka xihlawuhlawu eafrikadzonga, vavuyeriwa lava nga ringanela eka ndzhaka leyo xiximeka.

src_text: the mission of 1976 generation was to dismantle bantu education; that of today’s youth is to take forward the project of national reconciliation and transformation.
tgt_text: kungu ra rixaka ra 1976 a ku ri ku ntlhatlha dyondzo ya bantu, lera vantshwa vasweswi i kuyisa emahlweni phurojeke ya rixaka ya ku rivalelana na ku cinca.

src_text: in time to come it will be said that this year, 2020, marked the start of a new epoch in human history.
tgt_text: eka nkarhi lowutaka swi ta vuriwa ku ri eka lembe leri ra 2020, swi funghile ku sungula ka nguva leyintshwa eka matimu ya vanhu.

src_text: not only has coronavirus had a momentous impact on people’s lives and livelihoods, it has also shaken up the global social order.
tgt_text: khoronavhayirasi a yi khumbhanga vutomi bya vanhu na tshamiseko wa vona ntsena, yi tlhele yi ninginisa mahanyelo ya ntolovelo emisaveni hinkwayo.

src_text: the manner in which the pandemic has taken hold has been a reminder of the interconnectedness of the human race and of the deep inequalities that exist between countries and within countries.
tgt_text: hi mikhuva lowu ntungu wu nga hangalaka hakona wu hi xitsundzuxa hilaha hi nga hlanganana hakona tanihi hi rixaka ra vanhu na ku pfumaleka ka ku ringana exikarhi ka matiko na le ndzeni ka matiko.

src_text: the pandemic presents an opportunity to ‘reset’ a world that is characterised by crass materialism, selfishness and selfabsorption not just on the part of individuals but whole societies.
tgt_text: ntungu lowu wu hi nyika xivandlanene xa ku tlhela hi "vuyelerisa" misava leyi nga taleriwa hi ku hanya hi swa hava, ku tihanyela wexe na ku tibuma, ku nga ri eka munhu ntsena kambe eka rixaka hinkwaro.

tgt_text: ku seketela ntirho lowu vatirhi va ka hina va vuthu ra le mahlweni va wu endlaka etikweni hinkwaro hi le ku rhumeleni ka vaholobye na swandla swa vaholobye eka xin'wana na xin'wana xa swifundzatsongo etikweni ku vona hi ya hina mahlo mitlhontlho yo karhi leyi nga eka swifundzatsongo leswi na ku tirha na valawuri va swa rihanyo va swifundzakulu.

src_text: to support the work that our frontline workers are performing around the country we are deploying ministers and deputy ministers to each of the districts in the country to get a line of sight of specific challenges in these districts and to work with provincial health authorities.
tgt_text: hi dinga ku tirhisana ku teka magoza yo sirhelela rihanyo ku nga ri ntsena ra vatirhi va ka hina va vuthu ra le mahlweni kambe vuthu hinkwaro ra vatirhi.

src_text: we need to work together to safeguard the health of not just our frontline workers but the entire workforce.
tgt_text: se ku vile na ntirho wa kahle swinene lowu endliweke hi tiyuniyoni eka ku dyondzisa swirho hi mayelana na vulawuri na nsivelo na nsive lamavabyi.

src_text: there has already been sterling work done by unions in educating members around infection control and prevention and hygiene.
tgt_text: ti tlhela ti seketela ntirho wa ndzawulo ya mitirho na vatirhi eka ku endla vukamberi bya le ndhawini ya ntirho ku tiyisisa leswaku ku na milawu ya rihanyo na vuhlayiseki leyi simekiweke ya vatirhi lava vuyelaka entirhweni.

src_text: they are also supporting the work of the department of employment and labour in conducting workplace inspections to ensure health and safety protocols are in place for returning workers.
tgt_text: to tala ta tiyuniyoni ta vatirhi titlhela ti nyika swirho swa tona vuxokoxoko bya khoronavhayirasi naswona vathori va le ku endleni ka mapfhumba ya vulemukisi.

src_text: many of our trade unions are also providing coronavirus information to their members and employers are running awareness campaigns.
tgt_text: wun'wana wa mitlhontlho leyi yi tumbulukeke etikweni ra ka hina i ku hlekuriwa ka vanhu lava va kombeke vumbhoni bya ku va na khoronavhayirasi.

src_text: one of the challenges that has emerged in our country is the stigmatisation of people who have proven positive with coronavirus.
tgt_text: tanihi rixaka, hi na vutihlamuleri bya nhlanganelo ku simula ku hlekuriwa ka vanhu lava khomiweke hi khoronavhayirasi.

src_text: as a society, we have a collective responsibility to stamp out the stig matisation of people infected with the coronavirus.
tgt_text: ku vile na swiviko swo vavisa swa vanhu lava va nga eku tsan'wiweni emigangeni ya ka vona na swa ku va miganga yi kombisa ku vilela ehenhla ka vavabyi va khoronavhayirasi lava va amukeriwakaeswibedhlele na le titliliniki ta le migangeni.

src_text: there have been disturbing reports of individuals being ostracised from their communities and of communities protesting against coronavirus patients being admitted to local hospitals and clinics.
tgt_text: leswi swi boheka ku yima.

src_text: this must stop.
tgt_text: tanihiloko hi hlanganile ku kondletela ku amukeriwa ka vanhu lava hanyaka na hiv na ku yima hi tiya ehenhla ka ku xanisiwa, hi boheka ku komba ntwisiso, nkondzelelo, tintswalo, ku twela na ntwelavusiwana eka lavaya va tluleri weke hi xitsongwatsongwana na mindyangu ya vona.

src_text: just as we came together to promote acceptance of people living with hiv and stood firm against victimisation, we must show understanding, tolerance, kindness, empathy and compassion for those who are infected with this virus and for their families.
tgt_text: ku vuriwa leswaku ku hlekuri wa loku ku lawuriwa hi nchavo wa ku khomiwa vuvabyi nampfumaleko wa ntwisiso.

src_text: it is said that this stigmatisation is driven by fear of con tracting the disease and lack of understanding.
tgt_text: ndlela ya kahle swinene ku hlula nchavo wa rintumbuluko wa vuvabyi na ntlulelo wa vuvabyi i ku landzelela milawu ya nsivelamavabyi leyi yi simekiweke.

src_text: the best way to overcome our instinctive fear of illness and contagion is to observe the hygiene protocols that are in place.
tgt_text: nchavo wa ntluletavuvabyi wu kona hakunene naswona i ntiyiso.

src_text: the fear of infection is wellfounded and real.
tgt_text: hi nkarhi wun'we, ha swi tiva leswi hi bohekaka ku swi endla ku tisirhelela hina na van'wana.

src_text: at the same time, we know what we have to do to protect ourselves and others.
tgt_text: ha swi tiva leswi swi vangaka xitsongwatsongwana na leswi hi nga swi endlaka ku tisirhelela eka ku tluleriwa hi vuvabyi.

src_text: we know what causes the virus and what we can do to protect ourselves from becoming infected.
tgt_text: ha swi tiva leswaku hi boheka ku siya mpfhukanyana exikarhi ka vanhu, ku tiveka wexe loko hi khumbanile na lava va tluleriweke hi vuvabyi na ku ya exibedhlele loko hi ri na swikombeto.

src_text: we know we have to maintain social distancing, to selfisolate if we have come into contact with those infected and to present to a hospital if we have symptoms.
tgt_text: hi boheka ku ya emahlweni hi leteriwa hi mitiyiso naswona ku nga ri maveriveri.

src_text: we must continue to be guided by facts and not rumours.
tgt_text: nkarhi lowu munhu wihi kumbe wihi a nga vulaka leswaku a nga tivi munhu wihi kumbe wihi loyi a tluleriweke kumbe a khumbekeke hi khoronavhayirasi wu hundzile khale sweswi, kutlula leswi swi nga tshama swi va xiswona, vanghana va hina, mindyangu, vatirhikulobye na vaakelana va dinga ku tweriwa na nseketelo.

src_text: the time when anyone could say they do not know anyone who is infected or affected by coronavirus has long passed.
tgt_text: emasikwini, emavhikini na le tin'hwetini leta ha taka, mikarhi yin'wana hi ta tikuma hi ri na mimoya ya le hansi na ku va hi chava tanihiloko hi ri karhi hi vona tinhlayo ta vanhu lava khomiweke hi vuvabyi na ku lova ti ri karhi ti ya emahlweni ti tlakuka.

src_text: now, more than ever, our friends, families, colleagues and neighbours need our empathy and support.
tgt_text: ku nga ha va ku ri leswaku swilo swi nyanyile, kambe ha tiyisisa leswaku hi ta antswa.

src_text: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we will at times find ourselves despondent and fearful as we see the numbers of people infected and dying continue to rise.
tgt_text: van'watisayense va ka hina na vatsundzuxi va swa vutshunguri va hi byele leswaku mpimo wa mitluletavuvabyi wu ta tlakuka tanihiloko hi ri karhi hi ya emaninginingini.

src_text: it may be that things have gotten worse, but we are certain that they will get better.
tgt_text: kambe hakunene wu ta ya ehansi.

src_text: our scientists and medical advisers told us that the rate of infections will go up as we move towards our peak.
tgt_text: hi xixima vatirhi va swa rihanyo lava va lahlekeriweke hi vutomi bya vona va ri karhi va ongola vavabyi.

src_text: but it will certainly come down.
tgt_text: hi ku va tsundzuka, a hi tihlayiseni hina na vaakatikokulobye va hina hi ku tlanga xiphemu xa hina.

src_text: we pay tribute to the healthcare workers who lost their lives caring for the sick.
tgt_text: hi ta xi hlula xitsongwa tsongwana lexi kutani hi aka rixaka ra ka hina hivuntshwa.

src_text: in their memory, let us keep ourselves and our fellow citizens safe by playing our part.
tgt_text: hi vonile mikarhi yo tika swinene naswona hi humelerile.

src_text: we shall overcome this virus and rebuild our society.
tgt_text: nxiximo wo hlawuleka wa vatirhi va ka hina va nhlayiso wa swa rihanyo vukuzenzele unnamed nhlayo ya mafu hikwalaho ka khoronavhayirasi ku nga ri khale yi hundzile nthalo wa 2,000. exikarhi ka lavaya va lahlekeriweke hi vutomi bya vona i vatirhi va swa rihanyo, tiphurofexinali leti nga na vutivi na swikili leti a ti ongola vavabyi, naswona a va ri nseketelo na vakhongoteri va lava nga exibedhlele lava tivekeke voxe kusuka eka mindyangu ya vona.

src_text: young farmer receives covid19 support vukuzenzele unnamed nomagcinandile suduka (27) is growing her family’s legacy and wealth by investing in agriculture.
tgt_text: n’wamapurasi lontsongo a kuma nseketelo wa covid19 silusapho nyanda n’wamapurasi loyi a ha taka wa le kapavuhumadyambu hi un’wana wa vavuyeriwa va nkwama wa mphalalo wa khoronavhayirasi wa mfumo.

src_text: the o wner of 4 u and 4 me primary cooperative in mooiplaas village received support from the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development’s coronavirus (covid19) relief fund for her egg, livestock and vegetable farm.
tgt_text: nomagcinandile suduka (27) u kurisa ndzhaka ya ndyangu wa ka vona na rifumo hi ku vekisa eka vurimi.

src_text: the department has awarded r1.2 billion worth of vouchers to farmers in need.
tgt_text: n’wini wa 4 u na 4 me primary cooperative emu gangeni wa mooiplaas u kumile nseketelo kusuka eka nkwama wa mphalalo wa khoronavhayirasi (covid19) wa ndzawulo ya vurimi, antswiso wa misava na nhluvukiso wa matikoxikaya wa purasi ra yena ra matandza, swifuwo na matsavu.

src_text: suduka says her vouchers will help her grow the egg producing side of her business.
tgt_text: ndzawulo yi nyikile tivhawuchara leti nga na nkoka wa r1.2 wa tibiliyoni eka van’wamapurasi lava dingaka.

src_text: "i received three vouchers totalling r19 000. a voucher for r12 000 to buy layer egg chickens, a voucher for r6 500 to buy feed and a r500 voucher to buy medicines.
tgt_text: suduka u vula leswaku tivhawuchara ta yena ti ta n’wi pfuna ku kurisa tlhelo ra ku endliwa ka matandza ra bindzu ra yena.

src_text: "she started her egg production farm by feeding her family’s traditional chickens with layer grower feed, which enables them to produce eggs without mating.
tgt_text: "ndzi kumile tivhawuchara tinh arhu leti endlaka r19 000. vhawuchara ya r12 000 yo xava 100 ra tihuku to tshikela matandza, vhawuchara ya r6 500 yo xava swakudya swa tihuku na vhawuchara ya r500 yo xava mirhi."

src_text: her chickens now produce 50 eggs a day, which she sells weekly.
tgt_text: u sungurile purasi ra yena ra ku endla matandza hi ku phamela tihuku ta ka vona ta xintima hi swakudya swa tihuku to tshikela matandza, leswi swi endlaka leswaku tihuku ti tshikela matandza ti nga hlanganangi na tihuku ta xinuna.

src_text: suduka, who also farms with 73 goats, 25 sheep and 25 cows, started farming in 2015 after obtaining a public management n6 certificate from ikhala training and vocational education and training college.
tgt_text: sweswi tihuku ta yena ta 50 ti humesa 50 wa matandza siku na siku, lama a ma xavisaka vhiki na vhiki.

src_text: after realising that there were not a lot of job opportunities out there, she decided to take over the family’s then subsistence farm and turn it into a profitable business.
tgt_text: suduka, loyi a tlhelaka a fuwa timbuti ta 73, 25 wa tinyimpfu na 25 wa tihomu, u sungurile vurimi hi 2015 endzhaku ka loko a kumile xitifikheti xa yena xa n6 xa public management kusuka eka ikhala training and vocational education and training college.

src_text: suduka says: "we grew up practising farming, so after graduating i decided to farm rather than look for a job."
tgt_text: endzhaku ka ku lemuka leswaku a ku nga ri na swivandlanene swa mitirho swo tala le handle, u kunguhatile ku teka purasi ra ka vona ro tihanyisa a ri cinca ri va bindzu ro vuyerisa.

src_text: this proved to be an inspired decision, as she has grown the number of goats and cows.
tgt_text: suduka u vula leswaku: "hi kurile hi karhi hi titoloveta swa mapurasi, hikwalaho endzhaku ka loko ndzi thwasile ndzi kunguhatile ku endla vurimi handle ko lava ntirho."

src_text: suduka’s sixhectare vegetable farm produces maize, potatoes, peas and beans.
tgt_text: leswi swi tikombile kuri xiboho xa nhlohlotelo, tanihiloko a kurisile nhlayo ya timbuti na tihomu.

src_text: the maize is planted on four hectares, the potatoes on one hectare and the peas and beans share the last hectare.
tgt_text: purasi ra suduka ra tihekitara ta tsevu ra matsavu ri humesa mavele, mazambhala, swibalakatsa na tinyawa.

src_text: suduka has learnt a lot from covid19, especially that her best assets are her hands and hard work.
tgt_text: mavele ma byariwa eka tihekitara ta mune, mazambhala eka hekitara yin’we, naswona swibalakatsa na tinyawa swi byariwa eka hekitara yin’we leyo hetelela.

src_text: tips on how to start a garden: make sure you know which plants your soil will support.
tgt_text: suduka u dyondzile swo tala kusuka eka covid19 , ngopfungopfu leswaku rifuwo ra yena lerikulu i mavoko ya yena na ku tirha hi matimba.

src_text: ready your garden by first ploughing the land more than once without planting.
tgt_text: n’wamapurasi lontsongo a kuma nseketelo wa covid19 silusapho nyanda n’wamapurasi loyi a ha taka wa le kapavuhumadyambu hi un’wana wa vavuyeriwa va nkwama wa mphalalo wa khoronavhayirasi wa mfumo.

src_text: south africa acts to address ventilator shortage silusapho nyanda a locally developed ventilator will help patients with mild covid19 symptoms to breathe easier.
tgt_text: aforika borwa e tsaya dikgato go samagana le tlhaelo ya metšhini ya go thusa go hema silusapho nyanda motšhini wa go thusa go hema o o dirilweng ka fa nageng o tla thusa balwetse ba ba nang le matshwao a a seng bogale a covid19 go hema botoka.

src_text: the fight against the coronavirus disease (covid19) in south africa has been boosted with the production of the first ventilator made in the country.
tgt_text: ntwa kgatlhanong le bolwetse jwa mogare wa corona (covid19) ka fa nageng ya aforika borwa e tshegeditswe ka tlhagiso ya metšhini ya go thusa go hema e e dirilweng ka fa nageng.

src_text: the continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) ventilator helps patients with mild symptoms of covid19 to breathe easier by providing a mild level of oxygenated air pressure to keep their airways open.
tgt_text: motšhini wa go thusa go hema o o bidiwang continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) o thusa balwetse ba ba nang le matshwao a a seng bogale a covid19 go hema botoka ka go ba bodulolela mowa o o itekanetseng mo dikarolong tsa bona tsa go hema gore di se tswalege.

src_text: the ventilator was designed by the council for scientific and industrial research (csir) in collaboration with a number of local partners and will be rolled out nationwide to patients showing respiratory distress in the early phase of covid19 infection.
tgt_text: metšhini ya go thusa go hema eno e dirilwe ke lekgotla la dipatlisiso tsa saense le intaseteri (csir) mmogo le badirisani mmogo ba yona ba le bantsinyana ba ka fa nageng mme e tla phasaladiwa naga ka bophara go thusa balwetse ba ba nang le matshwao a go sokodisiwa ke go hema fa ba le mo tshimologong ya go tshwaediwa ke covid19.

src_text: "the air a person normally breaths has a 23 percent concentration of oxygen.
tgt_text: "mowa o gantsi batho ba o hemang o na le diphesente di le 23 tsa oksijene.

src_text: the cpap ventilator can pump a higher amount of oxygen, helping a person breathe.
tgt_text: metšhini ya go thusa go hema ya cpap e kgona go pompa palo e e kwa godimo ya oksijene, mme seno se kgona go thusa motho go hema.

src_text: the cpap pumps continuous concentrated oxygen.
tgt_text: cpapa e pompa oksijene e e sa feleng e e humileng.

src_text: you can increase or decrease the amount of oxygen one is breathing in," says executive manager of csir future production: manufacturing martin sanne.
tgt_text: o ka kgona go oketsa kgotsa go fokotsa oksijene e motho a e hemang," ga rialo molaodikhuduthamaga wa csir mo ditlhagisweng tsa mo isagong: tlhagisodikuno e bong martin sanne.

src_text: patients using the ventilator are connected via a face mask.
tgt_text: balwetse ba ba dirisang metšhini ya go thusa go hema ba e dirisa ka go apara maseke wa go thusa go hema.

src_text: oxygen is drawn from an oxygen gas tank and is mixed with natural air in the ventilator, from where it is transmitted to the mask and breathed in by the patient.
tgt_text: oksijene e tswa mo tankeng ya oksijene mme e tswakwa le mowa o o tlwaelegileng o o leng mo motšhining wa go thusa go hema mme go tsweng foo e fetela mo masekeng moo e tla hemiwang ke molwetse.

src_text: sanne says that in addition to pumping oxygenated air, the cpap also helps patients exhale.
tgt_text: sanne a re mo godimo ga go thusa go pompa mowa o o fetlhilweng ka oksijene, cpap e thusa gape balwetse gore ba kgone go hemela kwa ntle mowa o o tswang ka fa teng ga matshwafo a bona.

src_text: the cpap device can be used in both hightech clinical environments and temporary settings, such as field hospitals and quarantine facilities.
tgt_text: didirisiwa tseno tsa cpap di ka dirisiwa mo mafelong a bookelo a a dirisang thekenoloji ya maemo a a kwa godimo le mo maokelong a nakwana, a a jaaka dipetlele tse di leng kgakala le baagi mmogo le mafelo a go katosa bao ba nang le mogare.

src_text: sanne says the csir will have produced 10 000 ventilators by the end of august.
tgt_text: sanne a re csir e tla re kwa bokhutlong jwa kgwedi ya phatwe monongwaga ya bo e tlhagisitse metšhini ya go thusa go hema e le 10 000. ka tirisanommogo le siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya le yunibesiti ya motse kapa, csir e kgonne go tlhagisa dicpap ka go ikamanya le metheo ya mokgatlho wa lefatshe wa merero ya boitekanelo (who).

src_text: working with siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya and the university of cape town, the csir produced the cpap according to world health organisation standards.
tgt_text: metšhini ya go thusa go hema ya ntlha e tla neelwa dipetlele tsa puso tse di tobaneng le matsapa a go tlhoka didirisiwa tsa go samagana le covid19.

src_text: the first batch of ventilators will be given to state hospitals experiencing pressure due to the unavailability of equipment to deal with covid19.
tgt_text: csir e simolotse ka tiro ya go dira dicpap morago ga gore go nne le tlhaelo ya metšhini ya go thusa go hema mo lefatsheng ka bophara.

src_text: the csir started working on the cpap after the world began experiencing an extreme shortage in ventilators.
tgt_text: "mo kgweding ya mopitlwe le moranang, go ne ga nna le tlhaelo ya metšhini ya go thusa go hema mo batlameding ba rona ba boditšhabatšhaba.

src_text: "around march and april, there suddenly became a short supply of ventilators from our international suppliers.
tgt_text: fao e neng e le teng gone e ne e rekisiwa ka madi a a boitshegang mme puso e ne ya rebola thendara ya gore go tlhagisiwe metšhini ya go thusa go hema," ga rialo sanne.

src_text: where you could get them, they were very expensive so government issued a tender for the production of ventilators," says sanne.
tgt_text: thendara eno e ne e le karolo ya porojeke ya puso ya naga ya metšhini ya go thusa go hema e e neng e laolwa ke lefapha la kgwebisano, intaseteri le dikgaisano tsa dikgwebo.

src_text: the tender was part of the government’s national ventilator project within the department of trade, industry and competition.
tgt_text: csir e samagane gape le go dira motšhini wa go thusa go hema wa bilevel positive airway pressure (bpap) o maitlhomo a ona e leng go thusa balwetse ba ba leng mo maemong a a tlhobaetsang a covid19.

src_text: the csir is also working on a bilevel positive airway pressure ventilator aimed at helping patients with more severe symptoms of covid19.
tgt_text: aforika borwa e tsaya dikgato go samagana le tlhaelo ya metšhini ya go thusa go hema silusapho nyanda motšhini wa go thusa go hema o o dirilweng ka fa nageng o tla thusa balwetse ba ba nang le matshwao a a seng bogale a covid19 go hema botoka.

src_text: help stop the spread of covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed our nation is con fronted by the gravest crisis in the history of our democracy.
tgt_text: thusa go emisa go anama ga covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed setšhaba sa rona se tobane le matlhotlhapelo a se kana ka sepe fa e sale re nna le temokerasi ya rona.

src_text: for more than 120 days, we have succeeded in delaying the spread of a virus that is causing devastation across the globe.
tgt_text: sebaka sa matsatsi a feta a le 120, re atlegile mo go diegiseng go anama ga mogare ono o o dubang matlhotlhapelo lefatshe ka bophara.

src_text: but now, the surge in infections that we had been advised by our medical experts would come, has arrived.
tgt_text: fela ga jaanong, tlhatlogo ya ditshwaetso e re sa bolong go lemosiwa ka yona ke baitseanape ba rona ba tsa boitekanelo gore e mo tseleng, e re aparetse.

src_text: more than a quarter of a million south africans have been infected with coronavirus, and we know that many more infections have gone undetected.
tgt_text: palo ya maaforika borwa a feta kotara ya milione jaanong e tshwaeditswe ke mogare wa corona, e bile re a itse gore batho ba bangwe gape ba le bantsi go santse go sa itsiwe fa ba tshwaetsegile kgotsa jang.

src_text: we are now recording over 12,000 new cases every day.
tgt_text: jaanong re iphitlhela re bega dikgetse tse dintšhwa di feta di le 12 000 letsatsi le lengwe le le lengwe.

src_text: since the start of the outbreak in march, at least 4,079 people have died from covid19.
tgt_text: fa e sale mogare ono o supotsa tlhogo ka kgwedi ya mopitlwe monongwaga, batho ba feta ba le 4 079 ba setse ba tlhokafetse ka ntlha ya covid19.

src_text: like the massive cold fronts that sweep into our country from the south atlantic at this time of year, there are few parts of the country that will remain untouched by the coronavirus.
tgt_text: fela jaaka ditsuatsue tse di maatla tse di tsubutlang naga ya rona go tswa kwa karolong ya borwa jwa lewatle la atlelanta mo pakeng eno ya ngwaga, le ka mogare ono wa corona go tla nna le dikarolo tsa naga eno tse di ka se tsubutlweng ke mogare wa corona.

src_text: the coronavirus storm is far fiercer and more destructive than any we have known before.
tgt_text: setsuatsue sa mogare wa corona se bogale thata e bile se senya tota go gaisa ditsuatsue tse dingwe tse re kileng ra sutlha mo go tsona.

src_text: it is stretching our resources and our resolve to their limits.
tgt_text: se tlhotlhora metswedi le maitlhomo a rona tota.

src_text: the surge of infections that our experts and scientists predicted over 3 months ago has now arrived.
tgt_text: tlhatlogo ya ditshwaetso e re sa bolong go lemosiwa ka yona dikgwedi di le tharo tse di fetileng ke baitseanape ba rona ba tsa boitekanelo le ba tsa saense gore e mo tseleng, e re aparetse.

src_text: it started in the western cape and is now underway in the eastern cape and gauteng.
tgt_text: e simolotse kwa kapa bophirima mme jaanong e tsweletse go tsubotla kapa botlhaba le gauteng.

src_text: yet, while infections rise exponentially, it is important to note that our case fatality rate of 1.5 percent is among the lowest in the world.
tgt_text: le fa tota ditshwaetso di tsweletse go tlhatloga ka bontsi, go botlhokwa thata go nopola gore palo ya tlhatlogo ya dikgetse tsa dintsho ya phesente e le nngwe le halofo ke e nngwe ya dipalo tse di kwa tlase thata mo lefatsheng ka bophara.

src_text: this is compared to a global average case fatality rate of 4.4 percent.
tgt_text: eno ke fa re e bapisa le palo ya tlhatlogo ya dikgetse tsa dintsho e e tletseng mo lefatsheng ya diphesente di le 4.4. re tshwanetse go leboga batlhankedi ba rona ba boitekanelo ka maitemogelo le boineelo jwa bona mmogo le dikgato tse re di tsereng go ithulaganya sentle mo tsamaisong ya boitekanelo go bo re na le palo eno e e kwa tlase ya dintsho mo nageng ya rona.

src_text: we owe the relatively low number of deaths in our country to the experience and dedication of our health professionals and the urgent measures we have taken to build the capacity of our health system.
tgt_text: le fa tota go na le batho ba le bantsi ka fa nageng ba ba tsereng dikgato go thibela go anama ga mogare ono, go santse go na le ba bangwe ba le bantsi ba ba sa direng jalo.

src_text: even as most of our people have taken action to prevent the spread of the virus, there are others who have not.
tgt_text: go na le ba bangwe mo go rona ba ba itlhokomolosang melaokiletso eno e e neseditsweng pula gore e ka dirisiwa go lwantshana le bolwetse jono.

src_text: there are some among us who ignore the regulations that have been passed to combat the disease.
tgt_text: mo nakong eo re aparetsweng ke leroborobo leno, go namela thekesi o sa apara maseke wa go hema, go kokoana go etela ditsala, go ya meketeng kgotsa go etela balelapa, go dira gore go nne bonolo gore mogare o aname mme seno se ka tlhola dintsho.

src_text: in the midst of such a pandemic, getting into a taxi without a face mask, gathering to meet friends, attending parties or even visiting family, can too easily spread the virus and cost lives.
tgt_text: jono e ka tswa e le bolwetse jo bo tlhodiwang ke mogare, fela bo anama ka ntlha ya maitsholo a batho.

src_text: this may be a disease that is caused by a virus, but it is spread by human conduct and behaviour.
tgt_text: ka maitsholo a rona – re le batho ka borona, re le masika, re le baagi – re ka fetola ka fao leroborobo leno le itirelang ka teng boithatelo e bile re tshwanetse go dira jalo.

src_text: through our own actions – as individuals, as families, as communities – we can and we must change the course of this pandemic in our country.
tgt_text: re tshwanetse go apara maseke wa lesela o o thibang nko le molomo fa re tswa ka malapa a rona.

src_text: we need to wear a cloth mask that covers our nose and mouth whenever we leave home.
tgt_text: re tshwanetse go tswelela go tlhapa diatla tsa rona ka gale ka metsi a sesepa kgotsa ka go a tlotsa ka sebolayamegare.

src_text: we must continue to regularly wash our hands with soap and water or sanitiser.
tgt_text: re tshwanetse go tswelela go phepafatsa mafelo otlhe a a dirisiwang ka gale ke batho.

src_text: we must continue to clean and sanitise all surfaces in all public spaces.
tgt_text: se se botlhokwa go fetisisa, re tshwanetse go katogana – go katoga motho yo mongwe sekgala sa dimitara di le pedi.

src_text: most importantly, we must keep a safe distance – of at least 2 metres – from other people.
tgt_text: jaanong go na le bopaki jo bo supologang jo bo reng mogare ono o ka tsamaya ka dikarolo tse dinnye thata tse di leng mo moweng mo mafelong a go nyeumang batho mo go ona, a a tswalegileng kgotsa ao a sa tsenelweng ke phefo.

src_text: there is now emerging evidence that the virus may also be carried in tiny particles in the air in places that are crowded, closed or have poor air circulation.
tgt_text: ka ntlha ya seno re tshwanetse gore ka gangwe fela re tokafatse mafelo a batho ba tsenang ka fa gare ga ona ao mo go ona kgonagalo ya go anama ga mogare ono e leng teng.

src_text: for this reason we must immediately improve the indoor environment of public places where the risk of infection is greatest.
tgt_text: tshwetso ya rona ya go tsena mo kgatong ya go sekega nakwana ditiro tsa ka fa nageng e re thusitse gore re se gosomelwe ke ditshwaetsego tse dintsi re santse re le mo tshimologong fao ka nako eo maokelo a rona a neng a santse a ise a ithulaganye, e leng seo se ka bong se bakile dintsho tse di seng kana ka sepe.

src_text: our decision to declare a nationwide lockdown prevented a massive early surge of infections when our health services were less prepared, which would have resulted in a far greater loss of lives.
tgt_text: mo nakong eo re nnileng le yona, re tsere dikgato tse di botlhokwa thata go matlafatsa maokelo a rona gore a kgone go samagana le mogare ono.

src_text: in the time that we had, we have taken important measures to strengthen our health response.
tgt_text: re setse re dirile diteko tsa mogare wa corona di feta di le dimilione di le pedi mme ka fa letlhakoreng le lengwe batlhankedi ba boitekanelo ba ba tsenang ntlwana ka ntlwana bona ba setse ba dirile ditlhatlhobo tsa boitekanelo di feta di le dimilione di le 20re beetse thoko malao a ka nna 28 000 kwa dipetlele go thusa balwetse ba covid19 mmogo le go tlhoma dipetlele tsa nakwana tse di leng kgakala le baagi tse di dirang go ralala le naga.

src_text: we have conducted more than two million coronavirus tests and community health workers have done more than 20 million screenings.
tgt_text: ga jaana re na le malao a feta a le 37 000 kwa maokelong a puso le a poraefete go ralala le naga a a beetsweng balwetse ba ba nang le mogare ono mme ba tlhoka go katosiwa, a a letetseng fela go amogela balwetse bao ba batlang go ka katosiwa mo bathong ba bangwe mme ba se na ditlogo tsa go ka ikatosa ka bobona fa ba le kwa malapeng a bona.

src_text: we have made available almost 28,000 hospital beds for covid19 patients and have constructed functional field hospitals across the country.
tgt_text: re rekile ra bo ra romela dimilionemilione tsa didirisiwa tsa ipabalesego kwa dipetlele, ditleliniki le kwa dikolong go ralala le naga e le go ka babalela batlhankedi ba rona ba ba kopanang le badirelwa.

src_text: we now have over 37,000 quarantine beds in private and public facilities across the country, ready to isolate those who cannot do so at home.
tgt_text: re thapile e bile re tsweletse go thapa baoki, dingaka le batlhankedi ba tirelo ya tshoganyetso ya boitekanelo.

src_text: we have procured and delivered millions of items of personal protective equipment to hospitals, clinics and schools across the country to protect our frontline workers.
tgt_text: re tsweletse go nna le kgatelopele mo matsapeng a rona a go samagana le covid19, le fa go le jalo, kgwetlho ya rona e e namagadi e santse e tla.

src_text: we have recruited and continue to recruit additional nurses, doctors and emergency health personnel.
tgt_text: go ralala le diporofense tsotlhe, re samagane le go oketsa palo ya diphaposibookelo tse di amogelang balwetse ba malwetse a a farologaneng mmogo le malao a a tlhokegang go amogela balwetse ba covid19.

src_text: we continue to make progress in our efforts to deal with covid 19, but our greatest challenge still lies ahead.
tgt_text: mo dipetleleng di le dintsinyana balwetse ba ba sa tlhokeng kalafo ya tshoganyetso ba fokodiwa mo diphaposing tsa bookelo go romelwa kwa malapeng a bona, dikarolo dingwe tsa dipetlele di fetolwa go nna diphaposi tsa balwetse e bile go tlhomiwa kgotsa go okediwa gape le dipetlele tsa nakwana tse di leng kgakala le baagi.

src_text: across all provinces, we are working to further increase the number of general ward and critical beds available for covid19 patients.
tgt_text: re samagane le go oketsa tlamelo ya oksijene, metšhini ya go thusa go hema mmogo le didirisiwa tse dingwe gape tse di botlhokwa tse di tla tlhokagalang go thusa bao ba leng mo maemong a a tlhobaetsang, go tsenyeletsa go tlamela ka oksijene mabapi le ditirelo tse di rileng.

src_text: ward capacity is being freed up in a number of hospitals by delaying nonurgent care, the conversion of some areas of hospitals into additional ward space and the erection or expansion of field hospitals.
tgt_text: re dirisa thekenoloji ya dijithale go gagamatsa matsholo a go nopola, go gata motlhala le go beela kwa thoko batho bao ba kopaneng le bao ba tshwaetsegileng, mmogo le go tshegetsa bao diteko di fi tlhetseng ba na le mogare ono.

src_text: we are working to increase supplies of oxygen, ventilators and other equipment for those who will need critical care, including by diverting the supply of oxygen from other purposes.
tgt_text: jaanong jaaka re tsena mo maemong ao ditshwaetso di tla bong di le kwa godimo, re tlhoka go tsaya dikgato tse di gagametseng tsa polokesego mmogo le go gagamatsa dikgato tse ga jaana di leng teng go ka fokotsa lebelo la ditshwaetsego.

src_text: we are deploying digital technologies to strengthen the identification, tracing and isolation of contacts, and to provide support to those who test positive.
tgt_text: melawanataolo ya gore batho ba apare dimaseke e tla gagamadiwa.

src_text: as we now approach the peak of infections, we need to take extra precautions and tighten existing measures to slow down the rate of transmission.
tgt_text: bathapi, beng ba mabentlele le balaodi, beng ba dipalangwa tse di dirisiwang ke baagi, mmogo le balaodi le beng ba meago yotlhe e e dirisiwang ke baagi jaanong ke molao gore motho mang le mang yo a tsenang mo mafelong a bona kgotsa yo a namelang dipalangwa tsa bona o tshwanetse go bo a apere maseke.

src_text: regulations on the wearing of masks will be strengthened.
tgt_text: dithekesi tse di tsayang maeto a fa gautshwana di tla letlelelwa gore di ka tlatsa banamedi, mme tseo di tsayang maeto a maleele tsona di tla tshwanelwa ke go pega fela 70% ya banamedi, mme seno se tla letlelelwa fa fela ba ikamanya le dikgato tsa tsamaisokgwebo tse di ikamanyang le tiriso ya dimaseke, go tshela sejanaga seo ka sebolayamegare mmogo le go bula a mangwe a matlhabaphefo a sejanaga seno.

src_text: employers, shop owners and managers, public transport operators, and managers and owners of any other public building are now legally obliged to ensure that anyone entering their premises or vehicle must be wearing a mask.
tgt_text: jaanong go bopaki jo bo totobetseng gore go letlelelwa gore notagi e ka simolola go rekisiwa go nnile le ditlamorago tse di seng kana ka sepe mo dipetleleng, go tsenyeletsa le mo ditirelong tsa dikgobalo tse di masisi le mo ditirelong tsa diyuniti tsa balwetse ba ba lwelang botshelo le badimo, mme seno ke ka ntlha ya dikotsi tsa dijanaga, tirisodikgoka mmogo le ditiragalo tsa mothale ono tse di tlholang dikgobalo tse di masisi.

src_text: taxis undertaking local trips will now be permitted to increase their capacity to 100 percent, while long distance taxis will not be allowed to exceed 70 percent occupancy, on condition that new risk mitigation protocols related to masks, vehicle sanitising and open windows are followed.
tgt_text: ka ntlha ya seno, re tsere tshwetso ya gore, gore re kgone go somarela bokgoni jwa dipetlele go ka samagana le matsapa a re tobaneng le ona, thekiso, kabelano le phasalatso ya notagi e tla tshwanelwa ke go kgaotswa go tloga mo motsing one o. go tsaya kgato e nngwe gape go ka fokotsa boima jo dipetlele di bo rweleng, re tla tsenya gape le dikiletso tsa go tsamaya masigo magareng ga ura ya bo robongwe mo maitsiboeng le ura ya bone mo matsheng.

src_text: there is now clear evidence that the resumption of alcohol sales has resulted in substantial pressure being put on hospitals, including trauma and icu units, due to motor vehicle accidents, violence and related trauma.
tgt_text: re tsaya dikgatokiletso tseno re itse sentle gore ke tseo batho ba sa itumeleleng tsone mo matshelong a bona.

src_text: we have therefore decided that in order to conserve hospital capacity, the sale, dispensing and distribution of alcohol will be suspended with immediate effect.
tgt_text: fela di botlhokwa thata mo pakeng eno gore re kgone go kgabaganya paka eno eo bolwetse jono bo tlhatlogelang kwa godimo mo go yona.

src_text: as an additional measure to reduce the pressure on hospitals, a curfew will be put in place between the hours of 9pm and 4am.
tgt_text: ga go tsela e nngwe e re ka efogang setsuatsue seno sa mogare wa corona.

src_text: we are taking these measures fully aware that they impose unwelcome restrictions on people’s lives.
tgt_text: fela re ka fokotsa bogale jwa tshenyo eo e ka bo dirang mo matshelong a rona.

src_text: they are, however, necessary to see us through the peak of the disease.
tgt_text: re le naga kgetse eno ya tsie re e kgona ka go e tshwaraganela, ka go thoba matswalo a bao ba gateletsweng mmogo le go rotloetsana gore re amogele bao ba tshelang ka mogare ono.

src_text: there is no way that we can avoid the coronavirus storm.
tgt_text: mo motsing ono, go feta mo malobeng, re na le maikarabelo a go sireletsa matshelo a bao re tshelang le bona.

src_text: but we can limit the damage that it can cause to our lives.
tgt_text: re tla se sutlha setsuatsue seno.

src_text: as a nation we have come together to support each other, to provide comfort to those who are ill and to promote acceptance of people living with the virus.
tgt_text: re tla busetsa naga ya rona mo maemong a itekanelo le a khumo.

src_text: now, more than ever, we are responsible for the lives of those around us.
tgt_text: thusa go emisa go anama ga covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed setšhaba sa rona se tobane le matlhotlhapelo a se kana ka sepe fa e sale re nna le temokerasi ya rona.

src_text: celebrating women through economic inclusion vukuzenzele unnamed in august south africa celebrates women’s month.
tgt_text: ku tlangela vavasati hi nkatso ku tlangela vavasati hi nkatso eka swa ikhonomieka swa ikhonomi vukuzenzele unnamed hi mhawuri afrikadzonga ri tlangela nhweti ya vavasati.

src_text: this occasion marks the anniversary of the day in 1956 when 20,000 women marched to the union buildings – a great sea of womankind speaking many languages, from different places and of all races.
tgt_text: ntirho lowu wu komba siku leri fanaka ra 1956 loko 20,000 wa vavasati va macha ku ya eunion buildings – lwandle ra kahle ra vaxisati lava vulavulaka tindzimi to tala, ku suka eka tindhawu to hambana hambana na tinxaka hinkwato.

src_text: they were united in their demand for an end to the dreaded pass laws and for their right to live in freedom.
tgt_text: a va khomanile eka swikoxo swa vona swa ku herisa milawu ya pasi na timfanelo ta vona to hanya va ntshuxekile.

src_text: the status and position of women in south africa today is vastly different to that faced by our mothers and grandmothers in 1956. we have come a long way in realising a south africa that is nonracial, nonsexist, democratic, prosperous and free.
tgt_text: xiyimo xa vavas atieafrikadzonga namuntlha xi hambanile swinene na lexi a xi langutane na vamanana na vakokwana wa hina hi 1956. hi suka ekule eka ku kumisisa afrikadzonga leri nga yiki hi rixaka, rimbewu, ra xidimokirasi, ro hluvuka no ntshuxeka.

src_text: there has been real progress in improving the lives of south african women in the economy, in the political sphere and in public life.
tgt_text: ku vile na ku antswa eka ku antswisa vutomi bya vavasati va afrikadzonga eka ikhonomi, eka xiphemu xa tipolotiki na le ka vutomi bya mani na mani.

src_text: at the same time, we know there is so much further we still have to go.
tgt_text: hi nkarhi wun'we, ha swi tiva leswaku kahari na ndlela yo leha leyi hi faneleke ku yi famba.

src_text: women still face discrimination, harassment and violence, and bear the greatest brunt of poverty.
tgt_text: vavasati vaha langutane na xihlawuhlawu, nxaniso na madzolonga, na ku rhwala ndzhwalo lowukulu wa vusiwana.

src_text: if we are to truly realise the promise of our constitution we have to tackle the economic and financial exclusion that makes women more vulnerable to abuse and violence.
tgt_text: loko ho lava ku lemuka xitshembiso xa vumbiwa ra hina hi fanele ku languta nkatso wa xiikhonomi na wa ximali leswi swi endlaka leswaku vavasati vava va nga hlayisekanga eka nxaniso na madzolonga.

src_text: we have joined a groundbreaking campaign that links us to global efforts to achieve gender equality by 2030. generation equality is an ambitious and transformative agenda to end discrimination and violence against women and for their equal participation in political, social and economic life.
tgt_text: hi nghenerile khampheni leyi nga se tshamaku yi endliwa leyi yi hi hlanganisaka na kutinyiketela ka misava hinkwayo ku fikelela ku ringana ka rimbewu hi 2030. ndzingano warixaka i ajenda leyi naveriwaka no cinca ku herisa xihlawuhlawu na madzolonga eka vavasati na ku nghenelela loku ringanaka eka vutomi bya swa tipolotiki, xinakulobye naxiikhonomi.

src_text: as part of this campaign, we have joined two ‘action coalitions’, one for economic justice and rights and another against genderbased violence.
tgt_text: tanihi xiphemu xa khampheni leyi, hi nghenele ‘mihlanganelo ya swendlo’ yimbirhi, wun'we wa vululami bya ikhonomi na timfanelo na yin'wana ku lwisana na madzolonga ku ya hi rimbewu.

src_text: both of these themes are critical to our own national agenda.
tgt_text: tithimi leti havumbirhi ti na nkoka eka ajenda ya hina ya tiko.

src_text: eleven months since the emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide was implemented we have made progress in expanding support and care to survivors, and progress is being made in legal reforms to afford them greater protection.
tgt_text: khumen'we wa tinhweti loko kungu ra ku hlamula ra xilamulelamhangu ku lwisana na madzolonga kuya hi rimbewu na kudlawa ka vavasati ri simekiwile hi endlile ku antswa eka ku andzisa nseketelo na nhlayiso wa lava poneke, naswona ku antswa swi endliwa hi ku aka hi vuntshwa nawu ku va nyika nsirhelelo wa kahle swinene.

src_text: during the month of august, we begin the implementation of the national strategic plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide.
tgt_text: hi n'hweti ya mhawuri, hi sungula ku simeka kungu ra tiko ro lwisana na madzolonga yoya hi rimbewu na ku dlawa ka vavasati.

src_text: a key aspect of the plan is on ensuring greater women’s financial inclusion.
tgt_text: xa nkoka eka kungu leri i ku tiyisisa ku katsiwa ka vavasati eka swa timali.

src_text: this is because economic inequality and social inequality are interconnected.
tgt_text: leswi i mhaka ya leswaku kandzingano wa xiikhonomi na kandzingano wa vanhu swa fambisana.

src_text: the economic status of women in south africa makes them more vulnerable to abuse.
tgt_text: xiyimo xa vavasati eka ikhonomi eafrikadzonga swi va endla leswaku vava va nga hlayisekanga eka nxaniso.

src_text: we must therefore scale up support for women to enable them to become financially independent.
tgt_text: hi fanele ku tlakusa nseketelo wa hina eka vavasati ku endla leswaku va kota ku ti yimela hi swa timali.

src_text: we have made a number of commitments under generation equality that will be given effect to through the national strategic plan.
tgt_text: hi tibohile eka ndzingano wa rixaka lowu nga ta nyikiwa matimba hi kungu ra tiko.

src_text: firstly, we are going to drive women’s economic inclusion through public procurement.
tgt_text: xosungula, hi ta fambisa nkatso wa vavasati eka swa ikhonomi hi ku swikuma ka mani na mani.

src_text: we have set the target of ensuring that at least 40 percent of goods and services procured by public entities are sourced from womenowned businesses.
tgt_text: hi vekile xikongomiwa xo tiyisia leswaku kwalomu ka 40 wa tiphesente wa nhundzu na vukorhokeri lebyi kumiwaka hi swiphemu swa mfumo swi huma eka mabindzu ya vavasati.

src_text: secondly, we are going to scale up support for womenowned smmes and for women who work in the informal sector or are unemployed.
tgt_text: xa vumbirhi, hi ta tlakusa nseketelo eka tismme ta vavasati na vavasati lava tirhaka eka xiphemu xo ka xi nga pasisiwanga kumbe lava nga tirheki.

src_text: this will include engagement with the financial sector to make financial services accessible and affordable for women.
tgt_text: leswi swi ta katsa mburisano na xiphemu xa timali ku endla leswaku vukorhokeri byi fikeleleka eka vavasati.

src_text: thirdly, we want to ensure more women have access to productive assets such as land.
tgt_text: xa vunharhu, hi lava ku tiyisisa leswaku vavasati votala va kota ku fikelela ndhaka yo vuyerisa kufana na miasava.

src_text: it is essential that women are beneficiaries of the accelerate land reform programme.
tgt_text: swi na nkoka leswaku vavasati va va vavuyeriwa eka phurogireme ya endla antswiso wa misava.

src_text: it is significant that of the r75 million in covid19 relief earmarked for farming input vouchers 53 percent of the beneficiaries will be rural women.
tgt_text: swi na nkoka leswaku eka r75 timiliyoni ta mphalalo wa covid19 ti yisiwa eka tivhochara ta vurimi, 53 wa tiphesente wa vavuyeriwa kutava vavasati va matikoxikaya.

src_text: we must ensure that women subsistence and smallscale farmers continue to receive support beyond the pandemic.
tgt_text: hi fanele ku tiyisisa leswaku ku pfuniwa ka vavasati na van'wamapurasi lamantsongo va ya emahlweni va kuma nseketelo na loko ntungunkulu wu hundzile.

src_text: fourthly, we want to ensure that women are protected from genderbased violence in the workplace.
tgt_text: xa vumue, hi lava ku tiyisisa leswaku vavasati va sirhelelekile eka madzolonga yo ya hi rimbewu endhawini ya ntirho.

src_text: in this regard, we will be working at a national and regional level towards the ratification of the ilo convention on violence and harassment in the workplace.
tgt_text: hi ndlela leyi, hitava hi tirha eka xiyimo xa tiko na xa rhijini eka ku lulamisa ntolovelo wa ilo wa madzolonga na nxaniso eka ndhawu ya ntirho.

src_text: it is said that freedom is not given, but taken.
tgt_text: ku vuriwa leswaku ntshuxeko a wu nyikiwi, wo tekiwa.

src_text: the emancipation of women is only words on paper unless it is matched by commitment from all sectors of society.
tgt_text: ku ntshuxa vavasati i marito ntsena eka phepha handle ka loko ma fambelanisiwa na kutinyiketela kusuka eka swiphemu hinkwaswo swa rixaka.

src_text: as we prepare for the reconstruction of our economy in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, we have said that we cannot simply return to where we were before the outbreak of the virus.
tgt_text: tanihi loko haha lulamisela ku aka hi vuntshwa ikhonomi ya hina eka ku tumbuluka ka ntungunkulu wa khoronavhayirasi, hi vurile leswaku a hi nga tlheleli ntsena laha hi ri kona khale kungasi va na xitsongwatsongwana.

src_text: we must build a fundamentally different economy which, among other things, substantially improves the material position of women.
tgt_text: hi fanelel ku aka ikhonomi yo hambana leyi, exikarhi ka swin'wana, yi antswisaka swinene xiyimo xa vavasati eka switirhisiwa.

src_text: this means that our investment in infrastructure must support not only the development of local industry, but also womenowned businesses.
tgt_text: leswi swi vula leswaku vuvekisi ba hina eka vumaki byi fanele ku seketela kungari nhluvukiso ntsena wa indhasitiri ya le hansi, kambe na mabindzu ya vavasati.

src_text: it must deliberately create employment opportunities for women in all stages of planning, financing, building and maintaining infrastructure.
tgt_text: byi fanelel ku humelerisa tindlela ta mintirho ya vavasati eka switeji hinkwaswo swa ku lulamisela, ku hakela, ku aka na ku hlayisa miako.

src_text: by the same measures, as we scale up our public employment programmes, we must ensure that young women in particular are identified as participants.
tgt_text: hi tindlela leti fanaka, loko hi karhi hi tlakusa tiphurogireme ta mintirho, hi fanele ku tiyisisa leswaku vavasati lavantsongo hi ku kongoma va hlawuriwa tani hi vatekaxive.

src_text: in addition to an income, these programmes will provide them with an opportunity to acquire some of the skills and experience necessary to enter the mainstream economy.
tgt_text: ku tatisa eka muholo, tiphurogireme leti ti ta nyika tindlela to kuma vuswikoti na ntokoto lowu faneleke ku nghena eka ikhonomi.

src_text: as much as it is government’s responsibility to provide economic opportunities for women and create an enabling framework for advancing gender equality, everyone in society needs to play their part.
tgt_text: tanihi loko kuri vutihlamuleri bya mgumo ku nyika tindlela ta ikhonomi eka vavasati na ku endla rimba leri pfumelelaka ku antswisa ndzingano wa rimbewu, un'wana na un'wana eka rixaka u fanele ku tlanga xiphemu xa yena.

src_text: businesses must support womenowned enterprises in the procurement of goods and services.
tgt_text: mabindzu ma fanele ku seketela mabindzu ya vavasati ku kuma nhundzu na vukorhokeri.

src_text: they should employ more women and appoint more women to management positions.
tgt_text: va fanele ku thola vavasati votala naswona va thola vavasati eka swiyimo swa vurhangeri.

src_text: this is all the more important considering that the private sector’s record on genderrepresentation at management level lags behind that of the public sector.
tgt_text: leswi hinkwaswo swi na nkoka loko hi languta rhekhodo ya xiphemu xoka xi ngari xa mfumo eka kuyimela rimbewu eka nkarhi wa le ndhaku wa levhele ya vurhangeri eka mfumo.

src_text: this is an issue that is repeatedly raised in engagements i have had with a number of women’s business organisations.
tgt_text: leyi i mhaka leyi yi tshamaka yi kha yi vuriwa eka miburisano leyi ni ngava na yona na minhlangano ya mabindzu ya vavasati yo hlaya.

src_text: by equal measure, we must eliminate gender disparities in pay for men and women, and give effect to the principle of equal pay for equal work contained in the employment equity act.
tgt_text: hi mpimo wo ringana, hi fanele ku herisa kandzingano wa rimbewu eka hakelo ya vavanuna na vavasati, na ku teketela enhlokweni nawu wa hakelo yo ringana ya ntirho wo ringana leswi nga eka nawu wa ndzingano wa ntirho.

src_text: women must also be protected from harassment and discrimination in the workplace.

src_text: we must forge ahead with our efforts to eradicate chauvinism, sexism and patriarchy.
