src_text: let’s keep each other safe vukuzenzele unnamed our country has moved to alert level 2 in our response to the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt_text: a hi hlayisaneni vukuzenzele unnamed tiko ra hina ri sukile ri ya eka levhele ya vulemukisi ya 2 eka ku hlamula ka hina eka ntungukulu wa khoro navhayirasi.

src_text: this has come as a relief to all south africans who have had to live under stringent restrictions for the last five months.
tgt_text: leswi swi antswiserile maafrikadzonga hinkwavo lava a va boheka ku hanya ehansi ka ku aleriwa ko tika eka tin’hweti ta ntlhanu leti nga hundza.

src_text: it is a sign of the progress we are making in reducing new infections and demand on our health facilities.
tgt_text: i xikombiso xa ku antswa loku hi ku endlaka eka ku hunguta mitluletovuvabyi na nkayivelo eka tindhawu ta hina ta rihanyu.

src_text: it is also a very important development as we strive to restart our economy.
tgt_text: ku tlhela ku va antswiso wa nkoka swinene tanihi loko hi lava ku sungurisa ikhonomi ya hina.

src_text: but it is too soon to celebrate.
tgt_text: kambe nkarhi a wuse pfumela leswaku hi nga tlangela.

src_text: we are still very much in the middle of a deadly pandemic that has taken over 11,000 lives in south africa alone.
tgt_text: ha hari exikarhi ngopfu ka ntungukulu wo dlaya lowu wu nga teka vutomi byo tlula 11,000 eafrikadzonga ntsena.

src_text: at more than half a million confirmed cases, we still have the fifth highest number of infections in the world.
tgt_text: eka hafu ya miliyoni wa timhangu leti tiyisisi weke, ha hari na nhlayo ya vuntlhanu hi kuva henhla ya mitluletovuvabyi emisaveni hinkwayo.

src_text: and there is always a chance of a resurgence of the disease.
tgt_text: kambe ku tshama ku ri na chansi ya ku tlakuka nakambe ka vuvabyi.

src_text: if we ever need a stark reminder of the need for vigilance, we should look to recent events thousands of kilometres away in new zealand.
tgt_text: loko hi tshuka hi lava xitsundzuxo xo helela xa xilaveko xa hiteko, hi fanele ku languta eka timhaka ta seswi leti nga ekule hi ma gidi ya tikhilomitara enew zealand.

src_text: three months since the country was declared coronavirusfree, new zealand is once again under lockdown.
tgt_text: i tin’hweti tinharhu ku tivisiwile leswaku aka hari na khoronavhayirasi, new zealand yi tlhele yi va eka ku pfaleriwa nakambe.

src_text: although the latest outbreak was of relatively few cases, the government swiftly reimposed lockdown restrictions.
tgt_text: hambileswi ku pfuka a kuri ka timhangu tintsongo, mfumo wu vuyelerisile ku aleriwa eka ku pfaleriwa.

src_text: similar restrictions have had to be reimposed in several parts of europe as they experience a ‘second wave’ of infections.
tgt_text: ku aleriwa loku fanaka ku vuyiseriwile eka tindhawu to hlaya ta europe tanihi loko va langutane na ‘gandlati ra vumbhirhi’ ra mitluleto vuvabyi.

src_text: these experiences show just how swiftly things can change when it comes to covid19.
tgt_text: mitokoto leyi yihi komba kahle leswaku swilo swi nga cinca hi ku hatlisa loko swita eka covid19 .

src_text: it is a wakeup call to any among us who may harbour illusions that we are even close to seeing the end of this grave public health emergency.
tgt_text: i xilemukisi eka un’wana na un ‘wana exikarhi ka hina loyi a nga vaka na swivono swa leswaku hi ngava hiri kusuhi na ku vona makumu ya mhaka leyikulu ya mani na mani ya xilamulelamha ngu ya rihanyo.

src_text: certainly, there are signs of hope.
tgt_text: hi ntiyiso, ku na swikombi so swa ntshembho.

src_text: the number of new confirmed cases in south africa continues to decline.
tgt_text: nhlayo ya timhangu tintshwa leti tiyisisiweke eafrikadzonga yi ya emahlweni yi chika.

src_text: at the peak of the disease just one month ago, we were recording around 12,000 new cases a day.
tgt_text: emaninginingini ya vuva byi eka n’hweti leyi nga hu ndza, a hi tsarisa kwalomu ka 12,000 wa timhangu tintshwa hi siku.

src_text: this has dropped to an average of around 5,000 a day over the past week.
tgt_text: leswi swi hungutekile ku ya kwalomu ka 5,000 hi siku eka vhiki leri nga hundza.

src_text: our recovery rate stands at 80 percent.
tgt_text: mpimo wa hina wa ku hola wu le ka 80 wa tiphesente.

src_text: as the country moves to alert level 2, many restrictions on social and economic activity have been lifted.
tgt_text: tanihi loko tiko ri ya eka levhele ya vulemukisi ya 2, ku aleriwa kotala eka timha ka ta ntolovelo na ikhonomi swi tlakusiwile.

src_text: with this comes increased risk of transmission.
tgt_text: leswi swi ta na nxungeto lowukulu wa hundziselo.

src_text: we now need to manage this risk and ensure the gains we have made thus far in containing the pandemic’s spread are not reversed.
tgt_text: swesi hi fanele ku lawula nxungeto lowu na ku tiyisisa leswaku ku vuyeriwa loku hi nga ku endla ku fika sweswi eka ku lawula ku hangalaka ka ntungukulu a swi tlheri seriwi endzhaku.

src_text: the greatest threat to the health of nation right now is complacency.
tgt_text: nxungeto lowukulu eka rihanyu ra tiko sweswi i nkaenelo.

src_text: it may be that we are now permitted to meet friends and family, to visit entertainment venues, to travel for leisure and to consume alcohol in restaurants, bars and taverns.
tgt_text: kungava leswaku sweswi hi pfumeleriwile ku hlanga na na vanghana na ndyangu, ku endzela tindhawu to hungasela, ku endzela ku ya wisa na ku nwa byalwa ema vhengeleni ya swakudya, tibara na swipotso.

src_text: but as the old adage goes, just because you can, doesn’t mean you should.
tgt_text: kambe tanihi loko xivuriso xi vula, hikuva u nga endla, a swi vuli leswaku u fanele u endla.

src_text: many people who have the coronavirus do not have symptoms and may not even know they are infected.
tgt_text: vanhu vo tala lava va nga na khoronavhayirasi a va na swikombeto naswona va ngava va nga switivi na leswaku yi va tlulerile.

src_text: this is a sobering reality because it means that any of us could be infected right now and could unwittingly infect others.
tgt_text: lowu i ntiyiso wa nkoka hikuva swi vula leswaku un’wana na un’wana wa hina a nga tluleriwa sweswi naswona a nga tluleta van’wana a nga switivi.

src_text: this is particular the case when visiting relatives, especially the elderly and those with preexisting medical conditions that render them vulnerable to infection.
tgt_text: leyi i mhangu ya loko hi endzela maxaka, ngopfu ngopfu vadyuhari na lava va nga na swiyimo swa ma vabyi man’wana lama ma va endlaka leswaku vava va nga hlayisekanga eka ntluletovuvabyi.

src_text: it is also true for attending religious services or cultural activities.
tgt_text: swi tlhela swi va ntiyiso eka ku ya eka tihlengeletano ta vukhongeri na mitlangu ya ndhavuko.

src_text: the ‘second wave’ of infections that several other countries have experienced is an everpresent possibility for us too.
tgt_text: ‘gandlati ra vumbirhi’ ra mitluletovuvabyi leyi matiko yo hlaya ya nga hlangana na yona hi leswi swi nga hi humelelaka na hina.

src_text: although many restrictions have been lifted, it does not mean they will not return should we experience a significant rise in infections.
tgt_text: hambileswi ku aleriwa ko tala ku nga tlakusiwa, a swi vuli leswaku a swi nga vuyeli loko ho humeleriwa hi ku tlakuka swinene ka mitluletovuvabyi.

src_text: this pandemic is a matter of life and death.
tgt_text: ntungu kulu lowu i mhaka ya ku fa na ku hanya.

src_text: we need to adapt and we need to be vigilant.
tgt_text: hi fanele ku tekelela naswona hi fanele ku hiteka.

src_text: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we must urgently focus our efforts on recovery.
tgt_text: eka masiku, mavhiki na tin’hweti leti taka, hi fanele ku hatlisa hi kongomisa mi gingiriko ya hina eka ku hola.

src_text: our economy and our society has suffered a great deal.
tgt_text: ikhonomi ya hina na vaaki va xanisekile swinene.

src_text: as we return to economic activity across almost all industries – and work to repair the damage done – we have a responsibility to not let our guard down as individuals, employers, communities, families, professionals, workers and citizens.
tgt_text: tanihi loko hi tlhelela eka migingiriko ya ikhonomi eka tiindhasitiri to tala – naswona hi tirha ku lunghisa laha ku nga onhaka – hi na vutihlamuleri bya kuva hi nga ti khomisi tingana tanihi vanhu, vathori, miganga, mindyangu, vatokoti, vatirhi na vaakatiko.

src_text: none of us wants a return to the early days of extreme lockdown restrictions.
tgt_text: kuhava na un’we wa hina a lavaka ku tlhelela eka masiku ya masungulo ya kualeriwa lokukulu eka ku pfaleriwa.

src_text: we want to move on with our lives.
tgt_text: hi lava kuya emahlweni na vutomi bya hina.

src_text: we want our friends and loved ones to remain healthy and safe.
tgt_text: hi lava leswaku va nghana na varhandziwa va hina va tshama va hanye kahle na ku hlayiseka.

src_text: as a nation, let us continue to work together to ensure that we progress.
tgt_text: tanihi rixaka, a hi yeni emahlweni hi tirha kun’we ku tiyisisa leswaku hi ya emahlweni.

src_text: the move to alert level 2 of the lockdown is not a ‘free for all.’ the rules on social distancing, mask wearing, social gatherings and international travel remain.
tgt_text: ku ya eka le vhele ya vulemukisi ya 2 ya ku pfaleriwa a hi swa ‘maha la eka hinkwaswo.’ milawu eka ku siya pfhuka exikarhi ka vanhu, ku ambala xipfa laxikadza, tihlengeletano ta vanhu na ku endzela matiko ma le handle a swi se pfume leriwa.

src_text: our success rests on our ability to abide by these regulations and to ensure that we each behave carefully and responsibly.
tgt_text: ku humelela ka hina ku le ka vuswikoti bya hina bya ku landzelela swinawana na ku tiyisisa leswaku hi tikhoma kahle na hi vutihlamuleri.

src_text: every time we are considering any form of nonessen tial activity, we should ask: what is the risk of infection to ourselves and to others?
tgt_text: nkarhi hinkwawo loko hi ehleketa gingiriko wo ka wu nga bohi, hi fanele ku vutisa: i yini nxungeto wa ntluletovuvabyi eka hina na le ka van’wana?

src_text: where there is a risk, even a slight one, it is better not to do it.
tgt_text: laha ku nga na nxungeto, hambi kuri wuntsongo, swa antswa ku ka u nga swi endli.

src_text: let us proceed, as ever, with caution.
tgt_text: a hi yeni emahlweni, tani hi khale, hi vukheta.

src_text: let us keep each other safe.
tgt_text: a hi hlayisaneni vukuzenzele unnamed tiko ra hina ri sukile ri ya eka levhele ya vulemukisi ya 2 eka ku hlamula ka hina eka ntungukulu wa khoro navhayirasi.

src_text: protect our women and children vukuzenzele unnamed a year ago, almost to the day, thousands of wom en, men and children marched to parliament to protest against a spate of rapes and killings of women and girls.
tgt_text: sirhelela vaxisati na vana va ka hina vukuzenzele unnamed eka lembe leri nga hundza, hi siku leri fana ka, magid i ya vaxisati, vaxinuna na vana va machile ku ya epalamende ku ya kombisa ku vilela hikwalaho ka ku tlakuka ka ku pfinyiwa na ku dlayiwa ka vaxisati na van'hwanyana.

src_text: at the time, the nation was reeling from the murders of uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess and a number of other women who had lost their lives at the hands of brutal men.
tgt_text: hi nkarhi wolowo, tiko a ri chavisiwile hi ku dlayiwa ka uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess na nhlayo ya vaxisati van'wana lava va nga lahlekeriwa hi vutomi bya vona emavokweni ya vaxinuna va tihanyi.

src_text: from all social backgrounds, young and old, students and working women, the peaceful protesters held aloft placards that read ‘enough is enough’ and ‘am i next?’.
tgt_text: ku suka eka vuyimelo hinkwabyo, lavantsongo na lavakulu, swichudeni na vaxisati lava tirhaka, vakombisa ku vilela vo rhula a va khomile tipulakhadi leti a ti tsariwile ku ‘enough is enough ’ na ‘ am i next?’.

src_text: the anguish and the anger was palpable that day.
tgt_text: ku vaviseka emoyeni na ku hlundzuka a swi tikile hi siku leriya.

src_text: as i received their clearly articulated demands, it was clear to me that we needed to act urgently and with determination.
tgt_text: loko ndzi amukela swikoxo swa vona leswi swi nga vekiwa kahle, a swiri erivaleni eka mina leswaku hi fanele ku tirha hi ku hatlisa naswona hi ku tiyimisela.

src_text: it was important to me that i did not respond with hollow words and empty promises.
tgt_text: a swiri na nkoka eka mina leswaku a ndzi hlamulanga hi marito yo komba ku lulama na switshembhiso swoka swi nga ri ntiyiso.

src_text: a few days later, i called a joint sitting of parliament, where we announced a r1.6 billion emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide (gbvf).
tgt_text: endzhaku ka masikunyana, ndzi vitanile ntshamo wa nhlanganelo wa palamende, laha hi nga tivisa hi kungu ra xilamulelamhangu ra angulo ro lwisana na madzolonga yoya hi rimbewu na ku dlawa ka vaxisati (gbvf) ra r1.6 biliyoni.

src_text: over the six months of its implementation, public spending in various government departments was reprioritised to support interventions for care and support for survivors, for awareness and prevention campaigns, to improve laws and policies, to promote the economic empowerment of women, and to strengthen the criminal justice system.
tgt_text: eka tin'hweti ta ntsevu leti nga hundza ta ku simekiwa, ku tirhisiwa ka mali eka tindzawulo to hambana hambana swi kongomisiwile hi vuntshwa ku seketela ku nghenelela ka nhlayiso na nseketelo wa vaponi, tikhampheni ta ku tivisa na nsivelo, ku antswisa milawu na tipholisi, ku tlakusa ku nyika vaxisati matimba ya xiikhonomi, na ku tiyisa sisiteme ya vululami.

src_text: and now we are on the cusp of the most farreaching legislative overhaul in the fight against gbvf.
tgt_text: naswona sweswi hi le ka xiphemu xa ku cinca ka ku lulamisa milawu eka ku lwisana na (gbvf).

src_text: three key bills relating to gbvf have been introduced in parliament recently.
tgt_text: milawumbisi yinharhu ya nkoka leyi fambelanaka na (gbvf) yi tivisiwile epalamende sweswinyana.

src_text: through the introduction of these bills, we are honouring the promise we made to the protestors last year and to all the women of this country.
tgt_text: hi ku tivisa milawumbisi leyi, hi xixima xitshembhiso lexi hi nga xi endla eka vakombisa ku vilela lembe leri nga hundza na le ka vaxisati hinkwavo va tiko leri.

src_text: the three amendment bills are designed to fill the gaps that allow some perpetrators of these crimes to evade justice and to give full effect to the rights of our country’s women and children.
tgt_text: milawimbisi leyi nharhu yiendliwile ku pfala mavangwa lama pfumelelaka vaendli va swo biha va vugevenga lebyi ku ceceleta vululami na ku nyika ku khumbheka hi ku hetiseka eka timfanelo ta vaxisati na vana va tiko ra hina.

src_text: these bills, once finalised, will help to restore the confidence of our country’s women that the law is indeed there to protect them.
tgt_text: milawumbisi leyi, loko yi hetisisiwile, yi ta pfuna ku vuyisela ku titshembha ka vaxisati va tiko ra hina leswaku hakunene nawu wu kona ku va sirhelela.

src_text: the first is the bill to amend the criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act.
tgt_text: wo sungula i nawumbisi wo simeka nawu wa ku cinca wa nawu wa vugevenga (milandzu ya swamasangu na timhaka leti fambelanaka) .

src_text: this creates a new offence of sexual intimidation, extends the ambit of the offence of incest, and extends the reporting duty of persons who suspect a sexual offence has been committed against a child.
tgt_text: leswi swi endla nandzu wuntshwa wa ku chavisa hi timhaka ta swa masangu, wu ndlandlamukela eka xiyimo xa nandzu wa ku endla timhaka ta swa masangu na xaka, naswona wu ndlandlamuxa ntirho wa ku mangala wa vanhu lava ehleketelelaka nandzu wa timhaka ta swa masangu lowu endliweke eka n'wana.

src_text: it expands the scope of the national register for sex offenders (nrso) to include the particulars of all sex offenders.
tgt_text: wu anamisa xiyimo xa rhijisitara ra tiko ra vaendli va swobiha hi timhaka ta swa masangu (nrso) ku katsa vuxokoxoko bya vaendli va swobiha hi timhaka ta swa masangu hinkwavo.

src_text: until now, it has only applied to sex offenders convicted of sex crimes perpetrated against children or persons with mental disabilities.
tgt_text: ku fika sweswi, swi endli wile ntsena eka vaendli va swo biha hi timhaka ta swa masangu lava nga voniwa nandzu wo xanisa hi timhaka ta swa masangu eka vana kumbe vanhu lava nga tsoniwa emiehleketweni.

src_text: the time an offender’s particulars must remain on the register has been increased, and those listed on the register will have to disclose this when they submit applications to work with vulnerable persons.
tgt_text: nkarhi lowu vuxokoxoko bya vaendli va swo biha byi faneleke ku tshama wona eka rhijisitara wu engeteleriwile, naswona lava va nga tsariwa eka rhijisitara va ta fanela ku vula loko va rhumela swikombelo swa ku tirha na vanhu lava nga sirhelelekangiki.

src_text: the bill also provides for the names of persons on the nrso to be publicly available.
tgt_text: nawumbisi wu tlhela wu endla leswaku mavito ya vanhu lama ma nga eka nrso kuva ma vekiwa erivaleni.

src_text: the criminal and related matters amendment bill tightens, among others, the granting of bail to perpetrators of gbvf, and expands the offences for which minimum sentences must be imposed.
tgt_text: ku cinciwa ka nawumbisi wa vugevenga na timhaka leti fambelanaka swa tiya, exikarhi ka swin'wana, ku nyikiwa ka beyili eka vaendli va swo biha va gbvf , na ku anamisa milandzu laha xigwevo xale hansi xi faneleke ku sindzisiwa.

src_text: the amendments impose new obligations on lawenforcement officials and on our courts.
tgt_text: ku cinca ku sindzisa timfanelo tintshwa eka vatirhi va nawu na le ka tikhoto ta hina.

src_text: when a prosecutor does not oppose bail in cases of gbv, they have to place their reasons on record.
tgt_text: loko muchuchisi a nga kaneti beyili eka milandzu ya gbv , u fanele ku rhekhoda swivangelo swa yena.

src_text: unless a person accused of gbv can provide exceptional circumstances why they should be released on bail, the court must order their detention until the criminal proceedings are concluded.
tgt_text: handle ka loko muehleketeleriwa wa gbv a nga nyikaka mhaka ya leswaku hikokwalaho ka yini a fanele ku humesiwa hi beyili, khoto yi fanele ku kombela ku alela kukondza mafambiselo ya nandzu wa vugevenga wu fika emakumu.

src_text: in reaching a decision on a bail application, the courts are compelled to take a number of considerations into account.
tgt_text: eka ku fikelela xiboho xa xikombelo xa beyili, tikhoto ti boheka ku tekela enhlokweni timhaka to hlaya.

src_text: they include pretrial reports on the desirability of releasing an accused on bail, threats of violence made against a survivor, and the view of the survivor regarding his or her safety.
tgt_text: ti katsa tirhipoto ta loko ku nga si sungula ku tengiwa eka ku navela ka ku humesiwa ka muehleketeleriwa hi beyili, ku chavisiwa hi madzolon ga leswi nga endliwa eka muponi, na mavonelo ya muponi eka vuhlayiseki bya yena.

src_text: when it comes to parole, a complainant or a relative of a deceased victim must be able to make representation to the parole board.
tgt_text: loko swita eka paroli, mumangali kumbe xaka ra muxanisiwa loyi a nga lova u fanele ku kota ku endla vuyimeri eka bodo ya paroli.

src_text: given the unacceptably high levels of intimate partner violence in our country, we have tightened the provisions of the domestic violence act.
tgt_text: kuya hi levhele ya le henhla ya madzolonga ya muhlekisani etikweni ra hina, hi tiyisile swiphemu swa nawu wa madzolonga ya le mindyangwini.

src_text: domestic violence is now defined to cover those in engagements, dating, in customary relationships, and actual or perceived romantic, intimate or sexual relationships of any duration.
tgt_text: madzolonga ya le mindyangwini sweswi ya tirhisiwa ku pfala lava va nga tshembhisana vukati, lava rhandzanaka, lava nga ka vukati bya xintu, na leswi lava tekiwaka tanihi varhandzani, vuxaka bya le kusuhi kumbe bya timhaka ta swa masangu bya nkarhi wihi kumbe wihi.

src_text: the bill also extends the definition of ‘domestic violence’ to include the protection of older persons against abuse by family members.
tgt_text: nawumbisi wu tlhela wu anamisa nhlamuselo ya ‘madzolonga ya le mindyangwini’ ku katsa nsirhe lelo wa vadyuhari eka nxaniso hi vandyangu.

src_text: complainants will be able to apply for a protection order online.
tgt_text: vamangali va ta kota ku endla xikombelo xa nsirhelelo eka inthanete.

src_text: to prevent a scenario where perpetrators can hide past histories of domestic violence, an integrated repository of protection orders will be established.
tgt_text: ku sivela xiyimo laha vaendli va swo biha va nga tumbetaka matimu ya madzolonga ya le mindyangwini, ndhawu yo hlayisa misirhelelo yi ta endliwa.

src_text: the proposed amendments also oblige the departments of social development, basic education, higher education and health to provide certain services to survivors where needed and to refer them for sheltering and medical care.
tgt_text: ku cinca loku ku nykiweke mavonelo ku tlhela ku landzelela tindzawulo ta nhluvukiso wa vaaki, dyondzo ya masungulo, dyondzo ya le henhla na rihanyu ku nyika vukorhokeri byo karhi eka vaponi laha byi lavekaka na ku va hundzisela eka nhlayiso wa vutshamo na rihanyu.

src_text: the circumstances under which a prosecutor can refuse to institute a prosecution when offences have been committed under the amended act or to withdraw charges when it involves the infliction of bodily harm or where a weapon was used to threaten a complainant have been limited.
tgt_text: swiyimo leswi muchuchisi a nga alaka ku chuchisa loko milandzu yi endliwile ehansi ka nawu lowu cinciweke kumbe ku rhabisa nandzu loko swi katsa ku vaviseka ka miri kumbe laha xidlayi xi nga tirhisiwa ku chavisa mumangali swi pimiwile.

src_text: in perhaps the most groundbreaking proposed amendment to the act, if someone has knowledge, reasonable belief or suspicion that an act of domestic violence has been committed against a child, a person with disability or an older person and fails to report it to a social worker or police officer they can be fined and even imprisoned.
tgt_text: eka ku cinciwa lokukulu ka nawu, loko un'wana a ri na vutivi, ku tshembha ko twala kumbe ku ehleketelela ko twala leswaku madzolonga ya le ndyangwini ya endliwile eka n'wana, munhu loyi a nga na vutsoniwa kumbe mudyuhari naswona a tsandzeka ku mangala nandzu lowu eka soxaliweke kumbe phorisa va nga fayiniwa kumbe ku khomiwa.

src_text: similarly, failure by a member of the saps to comply with their obligations under the act will be regarded as misconduct and must be reported to the civilian secretariat for police service.
tgt_text: kufana na, ku tsandzeka ka membara ya saps ku landzelela milawu ehansi ka nawu yi ta tekiwa tanihi matikhomelo yo biha naswona yi fanele ku mangariwa eka matsalani wa vukhorhokeri bya maphorisa.

src_text: the law is the one sure protector of all of society, but especially its most vulnerable.
tgt_text: nawu hi wona hi ntiyiso wu sirhelelaka xichava, ngopfu ngopfu lava nga sirhelelekangiki.

src_text: when diligently and fairly applied, it is the most powerful guarantor of justice.
tgt_text: loko swi tirhisiwa kahle, i xitiyisi xa nawu xa matimba xa vululami.

src_text: the women of south africa have had enough of lukewarm actions that do not address one of the most fundamental rights of all – to live in freedom from fear.
tgt_text: vaxisati va afrikadzonga va karhelel hi swiendlo swo twela vusiwana leswi swi nga lunghiseki yin'wana ya timfanelo ta nkoka eka hinkwato – ku hanya eka ntshuxeko eka ku chava.

src_text: this government and its partners will make good by the women of south africa.
tgt_text: mfumo lowu na vakhomaxiave va wona va ta endla swakahle hi vaxisati va afrikadzonga.

src_text: we will not let them down.
tgt_text: sirhelela vaxisati na vana va ka hina vukuzenzele unnamed eka lembe leri nga hundza, hi siku leri fana ka, magid i ya vaxisati, vaxinuna na vana va machile ku ya epalamende ku ya kombisa ku vilela hikwalaho ka ku tlakuka ka ku pfinyiwa na ku dlayiwa ka vaxisati na van'hwanyana.

src_text: woza matrics launched dale hes this year’s ma triculants have to faced considerable challenges because of the coronavirus disease (covid19).
tgt_text: woza matrics yi simekiwa dale hes phurogireme ya woza matrics yi kongomisiwile ku pfuna vadyondzi va giredi 12 leswaku va pasa swikambelo swa vona.

src_text: the department of basic education (dbe) has ensured that the safe reopening of schools is one of its top priorities, along with supporting learners with various programmes to help them successfully complete the academic year.
tgt_text: vadyondzi va me tiriki va nan’wa ka va hlanganile na mitlhotlho yo tala hikokwalaho ka vuvabyi bya khoronavhayirasi (covid19).

src_text: one of these is the woza matrics programme, which was launched on 1 september in collaboration with a number of broadcasting partners and educational experts.
tgt_text: ndzawulo ya dyondzo ya masungulo yi tiyisisile leswaku ku pfuriwa ka swikolo nakambe i swin’wana swa swirhangana swa yona swa le henhla, ku katsa na ku seketela vadyondzi hi tiphurogireme to hambanahambana ku va pfuna leswaku va hetisa lembedyondzo hi ndlela leyi humelelaka.

src_text: as part of the programme, catchup lessons on six key matric subjects are being aired on sabc, dstv and openview (channel 122) every day for 12 weeks, from 8am to 10am and 1pm to 3pm.
tgt_text: yin’wana ya tiphurogireme leti i woza matrics , leyi simekiweke hi ndzhati hi ku tirhisana na vanakulorhi va vuhaxi na vativinkulu va dyondzo.

src_text: the goal is to help learners to prepare for their final exams.
tgt_text: tanihi xiphemu xa phurogireme, tidyondzoxidzi ta ntsevu ta ka metiriki ta karhi ta haxiwa emoyeni eka sabc, dstv na openview (chanele 122) masiku hinkwawo ku ringana mavhiki ya ntsevu ku suka hi 8 ku fika 10 nimixo na 1 ku fika 3 nimadyambu.

src_text: the platform also provides live lessons, during which learners can ask teachers questions.
tgt_text: xikongomelo i ku pfuna vadyondzi ku tilulamisela swikambelo swa vona swo hetelela.

src_text: exam tips are also provided.
tgt_text: switirhisiwa leswi swi ta tlhela swi nyika tidyondzo leti humelelaka hi nkarhi walowo ti haxiwaka hi wona, laha vadyondzi va nga vutisaka vadyondzisi swivutiso.

src_text: woza matrics recognises that while all learners have lost school time, grade 12s have been the most severely affected, as their marks are extremely important for their career and university acceptance.
tgt_text: switsundzuxo swa swikambelo naswona swa nyikiwa.

src_text: basic education minister angie motshekga says the programme is vital, considering the disruption to learn ing caused by covid19.
tgt_text: woza matrics yi lemuka leswaku hambileswi vadyondzi hinkwavo va nga lahlekeriwa hi nkarhi wa vona wo dyondza, vadyondzi va ka giredi 12 va khumbhekile ku tlula vadyondzi hinkwavo hikuva timaraka ta vona ti na nkoka swinene eka vumundzuku bya vona bya mitirho na ku amukeriwa ka vona eyunivhesithi.

src_text: "matric is always stressful, but 2020 has been filled with unusual stresses.
tgt_text: holobye wa dyondzo ya masungulo angie motshekga u vula leswaku phurogireme leyi yi na nkoka loko ku langutiwa ku kavanyetiwa loku ku nga va kona loku ku vangiweke hi covid19 .

src_text: i want to congratulate all our grade 12 learners and their families for their perseverance and determination.
tgt_text: "metiriki yi na ntshikelelo kambe 2020 yi vile na mintshikelelo yo tala.

src_text: it is abundantly clear that additional support is required for learners and we will continue to provide this.
tgt_text: ndzi rhandza ku hoyozela vadyondzi hinkwavo va ka giredi 12 na mindyangu ya vona eka ku tiyisela na vutinyeketi bya vona.

src_text: there are a few months left before the end of the year and woza matrics will give learners the support they need to prepare for the final exams," she says.
tgt_text: swi le rivaleni leswaku nseketelo wo ngetelela wa laveka eka vadyondzi naswona hi ta ya emahlweni hi endla tano.

src_text: the programme is unique in that it targets the majority of grade 12s in the country who do not have regular access to the internet and connected digital devices.
tgt_text: ku sele tin’hweti to hlaya hi nga si fika emakumu ka lembe naswona woza matrics ri ta nyika vadyondzi nseketelo lowu va wu lavaka ku tilulamisela swikambelo swo hetelela," a vula.

src_text: broadcasts will be available to view by most of the 1.2 million learners who are writing matric exams in november.
tgt_text: phurogireme leyi i yo hlawuleka hikuva yi kongomisiwile eka vanyingi va vadyondzi va giredi 12 lava va nga koteki ku fikelela inthanete na vuhlanganisi byin’wana bya xidijitali nkarhi na nkarhi.

src_text: the council of education ministers has urged all learners and parents to make use of the platform.
tgt_text: vuhaxi byi ta va kona leswaku byi fikelela vanyingi va 1.2 miliyoni wa vadyondzi lava va nga ta tsala metiriki hi hukuri.

src_text: sabc ceo madoda mxakwe says the broadcaster is proud to be part of the initiative.
tgt_text: khansele ya vaholobye va dyondzo yi khutazile vadyondzi hinkwavo na vatswari ku tirhisa switirhisiwa leswi.

src_text: "we are pleased to be one of the key roleplayers in saving the 2020 matric year.
tgt_text: ceo wa sabc madoda mxakwe u vula leswaku nhlangano lowu wa vuhaxi wa tinyungubyisa ku va xiphemu xa pfhumba leri.

src_text: as a public service broadcaster, we are dutyb ound to ensure that our content includes a significant number of educational programmes, particularly during a period when it is most needed.
tgt_text: "hi tsakile ngopfu ku va un’wana wa swiyengenkulu leswi tiyimiseleke ku sirhelela lembexidyondzo ra ka metiriki ra 2020. tanihi muhaxi wa tiko hinkwaro, ha boheka ku tiyisisa leswaku minongonoko ya hina yi katsa tiphurogireme to hlaya ta tidyondzo, ngopfungopfu hi nkarhi lowu ti lavekaka ngopfu."

src_text: "your questions answeredwhat subjects will be covered?
tgt_text: swivutiso swa wena swi hlamuriwahi tihi tidyondzo leti khumbhekaka?

src_text: maths geography life sciences physical sciences accounting maths literacy.
tgt_text: tinhlayo ntivotiko (geography) sayense ya vutomi (life sciences) sayense ya mbalango (physical sciences) ntivotinkota (accounting) tinhlayonhlayo (maths literacy).

src_text: why were these time slots chosen, because learners could be at school?
tgt_text: hikokwalaho ka yini mikarhi leyi yi hlawuriwile hikuva vadyondzi va nga va va ri exikolweni?

src_text: school attendance times vary across districts and provinces, due to social distancing measures.
tgt_text: mikarhi yo ya exikolweni ya hambana hi ku ya hi swifundza na swifundzankulu hikokwalaho ka nawu wo siya pfhuka exikarhi ka vanhu.

src_text: many matrics will be at home at the time of broadcasting.
tgt_text: vadyondzi va ka metiriki va ta va va ri emakaya hi nkarhi wa vuhaxi.

src_text: a small percentage of learners are also being homeschooled.
tgt_text: tiphesente titsongo ta vadyondzi na vona va karhi va dyondza va ri emakaya.

src_text: the main broadcasts will be repeated after 4pm on openview and are available on dstv catchup.
tgt_text: minongonoko yi ta haxiwa hi ku vuyelela endzhaku ka 4 nimadyambu eka openview yi tlhela yi va kona eka dstv catchup .

src_text: why only matrics?
tgt_text: hikokwalaho ka yini hi vulavula hi metiriki ntsena?

src_text: matrics are under the most pressure to plan their postschool lives.
tgt_text: vadyondzi va ka metiriki va le hansi ka ntshikelelo wo pulana vutomi bya vona endzhaku ka metiriki.

src_text: matrics have faced more significant disruption to their schooling since march 2020 because their curriculum was not shortened.
tgt_text: vadyondzi va ka metiriki va hlanganile na ku kavanyetiwa eka tidyondzo ta vona ku suka hi nyenyenyani hikuva vundzeni bya tidyondzo ta vona a byi hungutiwanga.

src_text: matrics have fallen the furthest behind on curricu lum learning.
tgt_text: vadyondzi va ka metiriki va tlhelerile endzhaku swinene eka tidyondzo ta vona.

tgt_text: xana nongonoko wa vuhaxi bya tidyondzo leti ndzi ta wu kuma kwihi?

tgt_text: nongonoko wa vuhaxi wa kumeka eka swiletelo swa tv na le ka webisayiti ya woza matrics eka wozama trics.co.za.

src_text: repeat broadcasts will be available.
tgt_text: vuhaxi byo vuyelela byi ta va kona.

src_text: is support being provided to parents and teach ers?
tgt_text: xana nseketelo wa karhi wu nyikiwa vatswari na vadyondzisi?

src_text: yes.
tgt_text: ina.

src_text: the broadcast schedule will have some sessions on tips for parents on ways to support their matric children.
tgt_text: nongonoko wa vuhaxi wu ta va na minongo nokontsongo ya switsundzuxo eka vatswari hi ti ndlela to seketela vana va vona lava endlaka metiriki.

src_text: some sessions will focus on teachers and the dbe's teacher connect whatsapp platform will communicate key messages to teachers.
tgt_text: yin’wana ya minongonokontsongo leyi yi ta languta vadyondzi naswona xitirhisiwa xa whatsapp xa ndzawulo ya dyondzo ya masungulo xa teacher connect whatsapp xi ta hangalasa timhakankulu eka vadyondzisi.

src_text: will there be a focus on dealing with the stresses faced by matrics?
tgt_text: xana nongonoko wu ta tlhela wu lwa na mintshike lelo leyi langutaneke na vadyondzi va ka metiriki?

src_text: yes.
tgt_text: ina.

src_text: there will be several sessions focused on providing tips for student wellbeing, coping with stress and managing anxiety.
tgt_text: ku ta va na minongonokontsongo yo hlaya leyi nyikaka swiletelo leswi yelanaka na vutomi bya swichudeni, ku lwa na ntshikelelo na ku chava.

tgt_text: woza matrics yi simekiwa dale hes phurogireme ya woza matrics yi kongomisiwile ku pfuna vadyondzi va giredi 12 leswaku va pasa swikambelo swa vona.

src_text: sa media is a key pillar of our democracy vukuzenzele unnamed in many countries around the world, the coronavirus pandemic has required the limita tion of many civil liberties and put social cohesion to the test.
tgt_text: mpaluxo wa sa i xiseketeri xa nkoka xa xidimokirasi xa hina vukuzenzele unnamed ematikweni yo tala emisaveni hinkwa yo, ntungukulu wa khoronavhayirasi wu endli le leswaku ntshuxeko wu hunguteka naswona wu ringa ku hlangana ka va nhu.

src_text: but countries with strong institutions, vigilant judicial systems and a robust media have been able to prevent human rights from being undermined and the authority of the state being abused.
tgt_text: kambe matiko ya ku va na swiphemu swo tiva, tisisiteme ta nawu leti langutelaka na mpaluxo wa matimba ma kotile ku sivela ku tekeriwa ehansi ka timfanelo ta vanhu na matimba ya ku va mfumu wu tirhisiwa.

src_text: it has been six months since the national state of disaster was proclaimed.
tgt_text: i tin’hweti ta ntsevu ku tivisiwile xiyimo xa mhangu xa tiko.

src_text: despite the unprecedented nature of the disease and the immense challenge of placing a country of 58 million people under lockdown, we have fared well.
tgt_text: handle ka muxaka wa mavabyi lowu nga si tshama ka wu va kona na xiphiqo lexikulu xa ku pfaleriwa ka tiko ra vanhu va 58 wa timiliyoni, hi tirhile kahle.

src_text: we have managed to contain the spread of the disease primarily because of the cooperation and vigilance of all citizens.
tgt_text: hi kotile ku lawula ku hangalaka ka mavabyi hikwalaho ka ntirhisano na vukheta bya vaakatiko hinkwavo.

src_text: this is in no small part due to the sterling work of our media.
tgt_text: lexi a hi xiphemu xintsongo ku ya hi ntirho wa kahle swonghasi wa mpaluxo wa hina.

src_text: we owe a debt of gratitude to south africa’s hardworking and tenacious journalists.
tgt_text: hi kolota ku titsongahata eka vateki va mahungu vo tirha hi matimba na ku ti nyiketela va afrikadzonga.

src_text: they have kept our people informed by disseminating key health messages about social distancing and hygiene.
tgt_text: va endle leswaku vanhu va ka hina va tshama va ri na vutivi hi ku hangalasa marungula ya nkoka ya swa rihanyu ya ku siya mpfhu kanyana exikarhi ka vanhu na rihanyu lerinene.

src_text: they have done so under extremely trying conditions, often with limited resources.
tgt_text: va endlile tano eka swiyimo swo tika swinene, nkarhi wun’wana na switirhisiwa swintsongo.

src_text: they have told the stories of the effects of lockdown on the lives of people and their businesses.
tgt_text: va hlamuserile switori swa ku khumbhiwa hi ku pfaleri wa eka vutomi bya vanhu na mabindzu ya vona.

src_text: they have been out in the villages, towns and cities, bringing stories of ordinary people and drawing national attention to problems being experienced in hospitals and clinics, prompting government action.
tgt_text: va humile vaya emigangeni, madoroba na madorobakulu, va tisa switori eka vanhu ntsena na ku kuma ku langutiwa hi tiko eka swiphiqo leswi ku hlanganiwaka na swona eswibedhlele na le titliliniki, ku tlakusa ntirho wa mfumo.

src_text: our media have also shone a light on excesses that perhaps would not have ordinarily come to light.
tgt_text: mpaluxo wa hina wu tlhele wu vangamisa kufikelela loku kumbexana a ku tava ku nga humelanga erivaleni.

src_text: they have fulfilled their watchdog role by unearthing acts of corruption and maladministration, sparking a massive national debate and leading to a number of highprofile investigations.
tgt_text: va fikelerile ntirho wa vona wa vulanguteri hi ku humesa mitirho ya vukungundzwana na vufambisi byo ka byi nga ri kahle, lebyi nga vanga njhe kanjhekisano wa tiko na ku kongomisa eka mindzavisiso ya xiyimo xa le henhla.

src_text: through this reporting they have earned people’s trust.
tgt_text: hi mavikelo lama va kumile ntshembo eka vanhu.

src_text: a free press is not an end in itself.
tgt_text: vuhumelerisi bya mahala a hi makumu hi byoxe.

src_text: it is a means by which democracy is secured and upheld.
tgt_text: i ndlela ya makumelo na mahlayi selo ya xidimokirasi.

src_text: during this pandemic, our media has played not just its traditional watchdog role, but exercised its civic duty in supporting the national effort to contain the coronavirus.
tgt_text: hi nkarhi lowu wa ntungukulu, mpaluxo wa hina a wu tirhanga ntirho wa wona wa vulanguteri ntsena, kambe wu tirhile ntirho wa wona wa ku hanyisa ku seketela matimba yo lawula khoro navhayirasi.

src_text: given the importance of the media to the health of our democracy, it is a great concern that like all other sectors of the economy, the coronavirus crisis has hit our media houses hard.
tgt_text: ku ya hi nkoka wa mpaluxo eka rihanyo ra xidimokirasi xa hina, i xivileriso lexikulu leswaku tanihi swiphemu swin’wana hinkwaswo swa ikhonomi, mhangu ya khoro navhayirasi yi khumbhile swinene tindlu ta mpaluxo ta hina.

src_text: some publications lost as much as 60 percent of their income in the early days of the lockdown.
tgt_text: vuhumelerisi byin’wana swi lahlekeriwile hi kwalomu ka 60 wa tiphesente ta mali nghena emasungulweni ya ku pfaleriwa.

src_text: a number of companies have had to implement salary cuts, reduce staff numbers or reduce hours worked.
tgt_text: tikha mphani to hlaya ti boheke ku hunguta miholo, ti hunguta nhlayo ya vatirhi kumbe ku hunguta tiawara leti tirhi waka.

src_text: regrettably, some publications have even been forced to close, among them some of south africa’s most established and wellknown magazine titles.
tgt_text: hikwalaho, vuhume lrisi byin’wana byi boheke ku pfala, eka byin’wana bya byona byin’wana i mavito ya timagazini leti humeleleke to tiveka swinene ta afrikadzonga.

src_text: the job losses that have resulted from the lockdowns have exacerbated a crisis for media companies already facing challenges like loss of advertising revenues, falling circulation and market share being taken by mobilefirst news and other technologies.
tgt_text: ku lahleka ka mitirho loku ku nga vangiwa hi ku pfaleri wa swi tikisile khombo eka tikhamphani ta mpaluxo leti tinga langutana na swiphiqo swo fana na ku lahlekeriwa hi mali ya vunavetisi, ku waka ku hangalasa na mali ya makete yi tekiwile hi va ma hungu ya inthanete na tithe kinoloji tin’wana.

src_text: these financial difficulties are being faced across the board, from online titles to traditional broadsheets to the public broadcaster.
tgt_text: ku tike riwa loku ka swa timali swi hlangane na votala, kusuka eka swiyimo swa xiinthanete ku ya eka vahumelerisi va mapephahungu va kuya eka vuhumelrisi bya tiko.

src_text: this was one of the issues that was raised sharply during my engagement with the south african national editors’ forum recently.
tgt_text: leyi i yin’wana ya timhaka leti nga boxiwa hi nkarhi wo burisana na foramu ya vu hleri ya tiko ra afrikadzonga a hi khale.

src_text: instead of lamenting their fate, however, the media industry is working hard to refine business models, to drive innovation and to retain staff as much as possible.
tgt_text: handle ko tiyisisa vukona bya vona, hambiswi ritano, indhasitiri ya mpaluxo yi tirha hi matimba ku pfuxeta tindlela ta bindzu, ku tlakusa ndlela yintshwa na ku vuyisa vatirhi hi ku hetiseka hilaha swi kotekaka.

src_text: at the same time, the media is a unique entity in any society because its practitioners fulfil a role that is so essential to our democratic order.
tgt_text: hi nkarhi wun’we, mpaluxo i xiphemu xo hlawuleka eka ndhawu yin’wana na yin’wana hikuva vatirhi va wona va fikelela ntirho wa nkoka eka xidimokirasi xa hina.

src_text: they work to keep the public informed and to keep power in check.
tgt_text: va tirhela ku endla leswaku vanhu va tshama vari na vutivi na ku kambi sisa matimba.

src_text: we need more journalists, not less.
tgt_text: hi dinga van’wamahungu vo tala, kungari vatsongo.

src_text: that is why the loss of even a single journalist is not just a loss to the industry but to the country.
tgt_text: hikokwalaho hambi kuri ku lahlekeriwa hi n’wamahungu un’we a hi ku lahlekeriwa ka indhasitiri ntsena kambe i ku lahlekeriwa ka tiko.

src_text: we need our media veterans, who bring with them vast experience and institutional memory, and are able to offer critical reportage and informed analysis.
tgt_text: hi dinga vatokoti va mpaluxo va ka hina, lava va taka na ntokoto na vutivi bya ntirho, naswona va kota ku nyika ku vika ka matimba na ku langutisisa ka kahle.

src_text: at the same time we need more young journalists in the profession who are techsavvy, abreast with new trends in storytelling and in touch with the concerns of a youthful population.
tgt_text: hi nkarhi wun’we hi dinga van’wamahungu va va ntshwa vo tala lava va tivaka swa thekinoloji, lava va nga na vutivi bya tithirende letintshwa eka mahlayelo ya switori na kutshama va tihlanganisa na swivilelo swa rixaka ra vantshwa.

src_text: as a society we owe the media our full support.
tgt_text: tanihi xichava hi kolota mapluxo nseketelo wa hina hinkwawo.

src_text: whether it is electing to pay for content, supporting crowdfunded journalism, paying our sabc license fees or simply buying a newspaper, we can all play our part to support this industry in crisis.
tgt_text: hambi kungava ku hlawula ku hakelela ma hungu, ku seketela mahungu ya ku halkeleriwa hi vanhu votala, ku hakela tihakelo ta layisense ya sabc kumbe ku xava phephahungu, hinkwe rhu hi nga tlanga xiphemu xa hina ku seketela indhasitiri leyi nga na swiphiqo.

src_text: as government, despite the gloomy economic climate we will continue to extend advertising spend to publications and broadcasters, especially community media.
tgt_text: tanihi mfumo, handle ka ku cinca ka ikhonomi hi ta ya emahlweni hi ndlandlamuxa mali ya vunavetisi eka vahumelerisi, ngopfunfopfu mpaluxo wa miganga.

src_text: the private sector must also continue to support the industry through advertising and working with media houses in the production of innovative content in line with global media trends.
tgt_text: xiphemu xoka xingari xa mfumo na xona xi fanele ku ya emahlweni xi seketela indhasitiri hi ku navetisa na ku tirhisana na tindlu ta mpaluxo eka ku humelerisa mahungu mo antswa lama fambisanaka na tithirende ta mpaluxo ta misava.

src_text: local philanthropic and donor organisations should also come on board and support public interest journalism ventures, as is the case in many democracies.
tgt_text: mi hlangano ya laha tikweni ya ku nyikela ya vutsari yi fanele ku nghenelela yi seketela tindlela ta mahungu leti tsa keriwaka hi vanhu, tanihiloko swiritano eka swidimokirasi swotala.

src_text: the proliferation of fake news during the pandemic, primarily on social media platforms, has added to the urgency for more news that is accurate, fair and impartial.
tgt_text: ku tlakuka ka mahungu yo pfumala ntiyiso hi nkarhi wa ntungukulu, ngopfu ngopfu eka swiphemu swa vanhu swa mpaluxo, swi engeterile eka kuva mahungu yo tala ya va na ntiyiso hi xihatla, ya kahle na ndzingano.

src_text: during this time our people have relied on our established media houses for information, once again underscoring their importance as pillars of our democracy.
tgt_text: hi nkarhi lowu vanhu vaka hina va tshembhele eka tindlu ta mpaluxo leti humeleleke ku kuma vuxokoxoko, nakambe va tshikelela nkoka tanihi vaseketeri va xidimokirasi.

src_text: as we begin the great task of rebuilding our economy in the aftermath of the pandemic, the media industry will need our support more than ever.
tgt_text: tanihiloko hi karhi hi su ngula ntirho wukulu wo aka nakambe ikhonomi ya hina eka leswi swi nga endliwa hi ntungukulu, indhasitiri ya mpaluxo yi ta dinga nseketelo wa hina ku tlula khale.

src_text: the free press was once described as ‘the unsleeping guardian of every other right that free men and women prize’.
tgt_text: mahungu ya mahala ya tshame ya hlamu seriwa tanihi ‘mulanguteri wo ka a nga etleli wa mfanelo yin’wana na yin’wana ya ku ntshuxa sagwadi ra vava nuna na vavasati’.

src_text: as we salute their role in this pandemic, let us do what we can to ensure that the free and diverse media in our country is able to survive and thrive.
tgt_text: mpaluxo wa sa i xiseketeri xa nkoka xa xidimokirasi xa hina vukuzenzele unnamed ematikweni yo tala emisaveni hinkwa yo, ntungukulu wa khoronavhayirasi wu endli le leswaku ntshuxeko wu hunguteka naswona wu ringa ku hlangana ka va nhu.

src_text: transforming the agricultural sector vukuzenzele unnamed recently, the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development (dalrrd) announced that members of the public will be able to apply to lease 700 000 hectares of underutilised or vacant state land in seven of the provinces.
tgt_text: ku cinca sekitara ya vurimi vukuzenzele unnamed sweswinyana, ndzawulo ya vurimi, antswiso wa misava na nhluvukiso wa matikoxikaya (dlrd) yi tivisile leswaku vaakitiko va ta kota ku endla xikombelo xa ntwanano wa xinawu ku tirhisa 700 000 wa tihekitara ta misava ya mfumo leyi nga tirhisiwiki ngopfu kumbe leyi nga pfuleka eka swifundzankulu swa nkombo.

src_text: agricultural land is the mainstay of our natural resource base.
tgt_text: misava ya vurimi i nkoka wa masungulo ya ndhaka ya hina ya ntumbuluko.

src_text: the availability and sustainable use of farmland to grow crops and for animal husbandry is key to our very survival.
tgt_text: ku kumeka na ku hlayiseka ka ku tirhisiwa ka misava ya vurimi ku byala swimilana na nhlayiso wa swifuwo i swa nkoka eka ku hanya ka hina.

src_text: south africa has vast tracts of land suitable for agricultural production, with 37,9% of our total land area currently being used for commercial agriculture.
tgt_text: afrikadzonga ri na ndhawu yikulu swinene yo ringanela vurimi, leyi nga na 37,9% ta ndhawu ya misava leyi yi nga ku tirhiseriweni ka vurimi bya bindzu.

src_text: like many other countries, our arable land is under threat from land degradation, water scarcity and urban encroachment.
tgt_text: kufana na matiko yo tala, misava ya hina yo ringanela ku byala swimilana yi le ka nxungeto wa ku onhaka ka misava, ku kala ka mati na ku tatiwa ka madoroba.

src_text: we are also losing prime agricultural land through landuse changes.
tgt_text: hi tlhela hi lahlekeriwa hi misava ya vurimi hikwalaho ka ku cinca ka matirhiselo ya misava.

src_text: given our history, broadening access to agricultural land for commercial production and subsistence farming is a national priority.
tgt_text: hi kuya hi matimu ya hina, ku anamisa mfikelelo wa misava ya vurimi ku endlela vuhumelerisi bya bindzu na vurimi byo ka byi nga ri bya bindzu hi leswi swi rhangaka emahlweni laha tikweni.

src_text: although the post1994 land reform process has resulted in more land being restored and restituted to black south africans, the pernicious effects of the 1913 natives land act continue to be in patterns of farmland ownership.
tgt_text: hambileswi tindlela ta antswiso wa misava endhaku ka 1994 ti hetelele hi ku va misava yo tala yi vuyiseriwa na ku tlheriseriwa eka maafrikadzonga, switandhaku swo vava swa nawu wa vinyi va misava wa 1913 swi ya emahlweni swi va eka tiphetheni ta vun'wini bya misava ya vurimi.

src_text: the act went far beyond dispossessing millions of people of their ancestral land.
tgt_text: nawu wu hundze na le ka ku tsona timiliyoni ta vanhu misava ya mikwembu ya vona.

src_text: with land ownership still concentrated in the hands of the few, and agriculture primary production and value chains mainly owned by white commercial farmers, the effects of our past remain with us today.
tgt_text: loko ka ha langutisiwe vun'wini bya misava emavokweni ya vanhu vantsongo, na vuhumelerisi bya masungulo bya vurimi na tindlela leti nga na nkoka leti to tala ti nga ta van'wampurasi va valungu va bindzu, switandhaku swa matimu ya hina swi sele na hina namuntlha.

src_text: the continued monopolization of a key means of production like land is not just an obstacle to advancing a more egalitarian society; it is also a recipe for social unrest.
tgt_text: vun'wini bya vanhu van'we bya tindlela ta nkoka bya vuhumelerisi lebyi yaka ema hlweni byo fana na misava a hi xirhalanganyi ntsena eka ku yisa emahlweni vaatikito lava tshembhaka eka ndzi ngano wa vanhu; swi tlhela swi va ndlela yo va vanhu va kala ntshamiseko.

src_text: the hunger for land to farm is growing, especially amongst the rural poor.
tgt_text: ndlala ya misava yi le ku kuleni, ngopfu ngopfu eka lava va nga sweleka ematiko xikaya.

src_text: and for a number of reasons, the pace of land reform in this particular sector has been slow and unsatisfactory.
tgt_text: naswona hikwalaho ka swivangelo swo hlaya, mpimo lowu antswiso wa misava eka sekitara leyi wa nonoka naswona a wu enerisi.

src_text: transforming patterns of agricultural land ownership is vital not just to address the historical injustices of the past, but to safeguard our nation’s food security.
tgt_text: tindlela to cinca ta vun'wini bya misava ya vurimi ti na nkoka ku nga langutiwi matimu ya leswi swi nga endli wangiki kahle ntsena, kambe ku sirhelela vuhlayisi bya swakudya swa tiko ra hina.

src_text: as noted in the 2019 report of the presidential advisory panel on land reform and agriculture, "whilst we export food, back home 41% of people in rural areas and 59,4% in urban areas have severely inadequate access to food."
tgt_text: tanihi leswi swi tsariweke eka xiviko xa 2019 xa phanele ya vatsundzuxi va phuresidente eka antswiso wa misava na vurimi, "loko hi xavisela matiko ya le handle swakudya, ekaya 41% ta va nhu ematikoxikaya na 59,4% emadorobeni a va na mfikelelo wa kahle wa swakudya."

src_text: agrarian reform has been a priority of successive administrations since democracy.
tgt_text: antswiso wa vurimi wu vile lowu rhangaka emahlweni eka vufambisi byo humelela kusukela loko ku sungurile xidemokirasi.

src_text: between 1994 and march 2018 the state has delivered 8,4 million hectares of land to previously disadvantaged individuals under the land reform programme.
tgt_text: exikarhi ka 1994 na nyenyakulu 2018 mfumo wu nyikile 8,4 wa timiliyoni wa tihekitara ta misava eka vanhu lava a va swelekile khale ehansi ka phurogireme ya antswiso wa misava.

src_text: but this progress amounts to less than 10% of all commercial farmland.
tgt_text: kambe ku antswa loku swi fika ehansi ka kwalomu ka 10% ta misava ya vurimi ya bindzu.

src_text: in my state of the nation address earlier this year i committed that stateowned agricultural land would soon be released for farming.
tgt_text: eka mbulavulo wa mina wa xiyimo xa tiko loko lembe ra ha ku sungula ndzi bohile leswaku misava ya vurimi ya mfumo yi ta pfuleriwa vanhu ku rima.

src_text: this is a major milestone in the agrarian reform process, and gives effect to the promise of the freedom charter that the land shall be shared among those who work it.
tgt_text: lowu i mpfhuka wukulu swinene eka phurosese ya antswiso wa vurimi, naswona wu nyika ntirho eka xitshembiso xa freedom charter xa leswaku misava yi ta avelaniwa eka lava va yi tirhaka.

src_text: our redistributive vision aims to strike a balance between social justice and redress, and enhancing agricultural output by bringing more black farmers into the mainstream of the economy.
tgt_text: xivono xa hina xo phakela hi vuntshwa xi kongome eka ku ringanisa exikarhi ka vululami bya vanhu na ku lulamisa, na ku antswisa ku humelerisa ka vurimi hi ku tisa van'wamapurasi va vantima vo tala eka ikhonomi hi yoxe.

src_text: land is a productive asset that generates profit and can be used for collateral to secure other assets.
tgt_text: misava i ndhaka leyi humesaka leyi nghenisaka ntswalo naswona yi nga tirhisiwa tanihi mpfuno ku kuma ndhaka yin'wana.

src_text: we have to ensure that land acquired for farming purposes is productively used.
tgt_text: hi fanele ku tiyisisa leswaku misava leyi kumiweke ku rima eka yona ya tirhisiwa ku vuyerisa.

src_text: to safeguard the allocated state land for farming purposes, the lease is not transferrable.
tgt_text: ku sirhelela misava ya mfumo leyi nyikiweke ku rima eka yona, mpfumelelo a wu hundziseki.

src_text: beneficiaries will sign a lease agreement with the state and pay a rental fee consistent with the land value.
tgt_text: vavuyeriwa va ta sayina mpfumelelano wa lisi na mfumo naswona va ta hakela rhente leyi fambelanaka na nkoka wa misava.

src_text: we must also ensure that farmers are supported along the road to sustainability and profitability.
tgt_text: hi fanele hi tlhela hi tiyisisa leswaku van'wamapurasi va seketeriwa eka ndlela ya nhlayiso na ku vuyeriwa.

src_text: as part of this programme, beneficiaries will be trained in financial management and enterprise development.
tgt_text: tanihi xiphemu xa phurogireme leyi, vavuyeriwa va ta leteriwa eka malawulelo ya mali na antswiso wa bindzu.

src_text: experience has shown that emerging and smallscale farmers often lack the financial skills to exploit market opportunities and integrate with value chains.
tgt_text: ntokoto wu kombile leswaku van'wamapurasi lava va ha ku sungulaka na lavatsongo va tala ku pfumala vuswikoti bya mali ku fikelela tichansi ta makete na ku tolovela tindlela ta nkoka.

src_text: we are prioritizing women, youth and persons with disabilities as beneficiaries.
tgt_text: hi tekela enhlokweni vavasati, vantshwa na vanhu lava nga na vutsoniwa tanihi vavuyeriwa.

src_text: there has been demonstrable success with empowering women farmers under the existing proactive land acquisition strategy.
tgt_text: ku na ku humelela ko kombeka hi ku tlakusa van'wamapurasi va vavasati ehansi ka qhingha ra malawulelo ya makumelo ya misava (plas) leri nga kona.

src_text: in a number of provinces, women who have been allocated farms by the dalrrd have been able to run them successfully and even move into commercial production.
tgt_text: eka swifundzakulu swohlaya, vavasati lava va nga nyikiwa mapurasi hi dlrd va kotile ku ma fambisa hi ku humelela naswona va yile eka ku humelerisa ka bindzu.

src_text: in addition to the land acquisition itself, the department continues to invest in infrastructure, equipment and machinery to enable these entrepreneurs to run successful businesses.
tgt_text: ku tatisa eka ku kumiwa ka misava hi koxe, ndzawulo yi ya emahlweni yi vekisa eka miako, switirhisiwa na michini ku kotisa van'wamabundzu lava ku fambisa mabindzu ya ku humelela.

src_text: broadening access to land and opportunities for farming will support job creation and enterprise development, and improve the market for food, agricultural goods and services.
tgt_text: ku anamisa mfikelelo eka misava na tichansi to rima swi ta seketela ku tumbuluxa mitirho na antswiso wa bindzu, na ku antswisa makete wa swakudya, swimakiwa swa vurimi na vukorhokeri.

src_text: the ultimate goal of releasing these land parcels is to transform the agricultural landscape by growing a new generation of farmers.
tgt_text: xikongomelonkulu xa ku nyika maphasele ya misava leyi i ku cinca misava ya vurimi hi ku kurisa rixaka rintshwa ra van'wamapurasi.

src_text: leasing land under such favourable conditions must spur them to think big; to not just grow their own businesses but to advance shared wealth and prosperity in the communities in which they farm.
tgt_text: ku lombisa misava ehansi ka swiyimo swa kahle hi ndlela leyi swi fanele ku va endla leswaku va hleketa leswikulu; kungari ku kurisa mabindzu ya vona ntsena kambe ku antswisa rifumu ra avelano na ndzalo eka miganga leyi va rimaka eka yona.

src_text: they must heal the deep divisions of our past.
tgt_text: va fanele ku horisa miavano ya matimu ya hina.

src_text: they must dispel the stereotype that only white farmers are commercially successful in south africa, and that black farmers are perpetually ‘emerging.’in working this land; in turning it to productive use, they will indeed turn swords into ploughshares.
tgt_text: va fanele ku herisa ntolovelo wa leswaku i van'wamapurasi va valungu ntsena lava nga humelela eafrikadzonga, naswona van'wamapurasi va vantima hi lava 'va ha sungulaka.’eka ku tirha misava leyi; eka ku yi cinca yi va leyi vuye risaka, hakunene va ta cinca matlhari ya va swikomu.

src_text: they will become the faces of national reconciliation.
tgt_text: ku cinca sekitara ya vurimi vukuzenzele unnamed sweswinyana, ndzawulo ya vurimi, antswiso wa misava na nhluvukiso wa matikoxikaya (dlrd) yi tivisile leswaku vaakitiko va ta kota ku endla xikombelo xa ntwanano wa xinawu ku tirhisa 700 000 wa tihekitara ta misava ya mfumo leyi nga tirhisiwiki ngopfu kumbe leyi nga pfuleka eka swifundzankulu swa nkombo.

src_text: building a society that works vukuzenzele unnamed the launch of the presidential employment stimulus last week marks a fundamental shift in our ap proach to tackling unem ployment.
tgt_text: ku hlohlotela ikhonomi leyi tirhaka vukuzenzele unnamed nsimeko wa xi hlohloteri xa miti rho xa phure sidente vhiki leri nga hu ndza swi fungha ku cinca ka nkoka eka endlelo ra hina ro tirhana na ku pfumaleka ka mitirho.

src_text: we are undertaking a farreaching and ambitious public investment in human capital, with the state as both a creator and an enabler of jobs.
tgt_text: hi le ku endleni ka vuvekisi bya mfumo lebyi angarhelaka swinene na ku va byo lava ku humelela eka xiyenge xa vatirhi, na mfumo havumbirhi tanihi mutumbuluxi na mukotisi wa mitirho.

src_text: the presidential employment stimulus is unprecedented in its scale and breadth, involving a public investment of r100 billion over the next three years.
tgt_text: xihlohloteri xa mitirho xa phuresidente lexi nga si tshamaka xi endliwa hi xikalu na vuanami bya xona, lexi khumbaka vuvekisi bya mfumo bya r100 ra tibiliyoni eka malembe manharhu lama taka.

src_text: we will protect and create directlyfunded jobs and livelihood support interventions while the labour market recovers from the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt_text: hi ta sirhelela na ku tumbuluxa mitirho leyi nyikiwaka timali hi ku kongoma na miphalalo ya nseketelo wa vutihanyisi loko makete wa vatirhi wu ri karhi wu hlakarhela eka ntungukulu wa khoronavhayirasi.

src_text: each of these is ready for implementation, and is additional to existing commitments.
tgt_text: xin'wana na xin'wana xa leswi xi lulamerile ku tirhisiwa, naswona i xitatisi eka vutinyiketi lebyi nga kona.

src_text: while some of the interventions build on the strengths of existing programmes, the stimulus also includes new and innovative approaches.
tgt_text: loko yin'wana ya miphalalo yi aka eka matimba ya minongonoko leyi nga kona, xi hlohloteri lexi xi tlhela xi katsa na maendlelo mantshwa.

src_text: this includes a focus on what we have termed ‘social employment’.
tgt_text: leswi swi katsa ku kongoma eka leswi hi swi vulaka ‘ntirho wa vanhu’.

src_text: we are working from the premise that there is no shortage of work to be done to address the many social problems in our society.
tgt_text: hi le ku tirheni kusuka eka xitatimente xa leswaku a ku na nkayivelo wa ntirho lowu faneleke ku endliwa ku tirhana na swiphi qo swa vanhu swo tala erixake ni ra ka hina.

src_text: the aim is to support the considerable creativity, initiative and institutional capabilities that exist in the wider society to engage people in work that serves the common good.
tgt_text: xikongomeloku lu i ku seketela vutumbuluxi byo tivikana, vuswikoti bya mapfhumba na bya nhlangano lebyi nga kona erixakeni hi ku angarhela ku nghenisa vanhu entirhweni leswi vuyerisaka hinkwavo.

src_text: this work cuts across a range of themes, including food security, ending genderbased violence, informal settlement upgrading and much more.
tgt_text: ntirho lowu wu nghena eka mikongomelo yo hambanahambana, ku katsa na nsirhelelo wa swakudya, ku herisa madzolonga yo ya hi rimbewu, ku antswisiwa ka swidakana na swin'wana swo tala.

src_text: this will supplement the efforts of the public sector, allowing for greater scale and social impact as well as new forms of partnership with diverse social actors.
tgt_text: leswi swi ta tatisa matshalatshala ya mfumo, swi pfu melela xikalu xa le henhla na nkhumbo wa vanhu xikan’we na mixaka yintshwa ya xinakulobye na vatlangi va vaaki vo hambanahambana.

src_text: the stimulus includes a new national programme to employ teaching and school assistants in schools.
tgt_text: xihlohloteri lexi xi katsa nongonoko wuntshwa wa rixaka wa ku thola vapfuneti va ku dyondzisa na va swikolo eswikolweni.

src_text: schools are making these appointments right now, delivering new opportunities in every community across the length and breadth of the country.
tgt_text: swikolo swi le ku tholeni sweswi, swi ri karhi swi nyika swivandlanene swintshwa emugangeni wun’wana na wun’wana etikweni hinkwaro.

src_text: public employment is not just for unskilled work.
tgt_text: ntirho wa mfumo a wo va ntsena mfumo va ntirho wo pfumala swikili.

src_text: there is a crosscutting focus on graduates, with opportunities for nurses, science graduates, artisans and others.
tgt_text: ku na ku kongoma ko katsa swiphemu hinkwaswo eka mathwasana, ku ri na swivandlanene swa vaongori, mathwasana ya tisayense, vatirhahimavoko na van'wana.

src_text: the stimulus will also protect jobs in vulnerable sectors that have been hit hard by the pandemic.
tgt_text: xihlohloteri lexi xi ta tlhela xi sirhelela mitirho eka tisekitara leti nga sirhelelekangiki leti ti nga hlaseriwa swinene hi ntungukulu lowu.

src_text: support will be provided to early childhood development practitioners, mainly selfemployed women.
tgt_text: nseketelo wu ta nyikiwa eka vatirhi va le ka nhluvukiso wa tindzumulo, ngopfungopfu vavasati lava va titirhaka.

src_text: over 74,000 small farmers will also receive production input grants.
tgt_text: kutlula kwalomu ka 74,000 wa van'wa mapurasi lavatsongo na vona va ta kuma malimpfuneto ya swicheriwa swa vuhumelerisi.

src_text: as a nation, we need arts and culture to lift our spirits once more – the stimulus provides new funding to help the sector back onto its feet, including support to digital contentcreation and expansion of ecommerce platforms.
tgt_text: tanihi rixaka, hi dinga vutshila na mfuwo ku tlakusa mimoya ya hina nakambe – xihlohloteri lexi xi nyika timali tintshwa ku pfuna sekitara leyi ku tlhela yi yima hi milenge ya yona, ku katsa na nseketelo eka ku tumbuluxiwa ka vundzeni bya swa xidijitali na ku ndlandlamuxiwa ka tipulatifomo ta mabindzu ya xielekitironiki.

src_text: this will enable artists to adapt to the new market conditions that the pandemic has imposed on us all and to seize new opportunities for growth.
tgt_text: leswi swi ta pfumelela van'wavutshila ku tifambelanisa na swiyimo swa makete leswintshwa leswi ntungukulu wu nga swi rhwexa eka hina hinkwerhu na ku teka swivandlanene swintshwa swa ku kula.

src_text: a critical enabler for wider job creation, made more important by the pandemic, is connectivity.
tgt_text: xikotisi xa nkoka swonghasi xa ku humelerisa mitirho hi ku angarhela, lexi endliweke xa nkoka swinene hi ntungukulu lowu, i ku khomananisa eka netiweke.

src_text: to overcome the digital divide, the stimulus will provide affordable, highspeed broadband to lowincome households through innovative connection subsidies and the expansion of free public wifi.
tgt_text: ku hlula xihingakanyi lexa xidijitali, xihlohloteri lexi xi ta nyika mfikelelo wa inthanete wo hatlisa, wo fikeleleka eka miti leyi nga na malinghena ya le hansi hi ku tirhisa timali ta mpfuneto ta nkhomananiso wa maendlelo lamantshwa xihlanganisi xa masungulo na ku ndla ndlamukisiwa ka wifi ya vaaki ya mahala.

src_text: as our country recovers from the devastation of the coronavirus pandemic, we are in no doubt as to the size of the task before us.
tgt_text: loko tiko ra hina ra ha hlakarhela eka ku onhetela lokukulu ka ntungukulu wa khoronavhayirasi, a hi kanakani hi mayelana na vukulu bya xintirhwana lexi hi nga langutana na xona.

src_text: we have to achieve an economic recovery that is swift and inclusive.
tgt_text: hi boheka ku fikelela nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi leyi hatlisaka na ku va ya nkatsahinkwavo.

src_text: we have to get as many of our people as possible working again.
tgt_text: hi boheka ku tlhelerisa vunyingi bya vanhu va ka hina eku tirheni hi xihatla.

src_text: we also have to regain lost ground in the provision of basic services and critical infrastructure, addressing social challenges and transforming townships and rural communities too.
tgt_text: hi tlhela hi boheka ku pfala ndzima leyi lahlekeke ya mphakelo wa vukorhokeri bya masungulo na swimakiwakulu swa nkoka swonghasi, hi tirhana na mitlhontlho ya vanhu na ku cinca malokixi na miganga ya le matikoxikaya na yona.

src_text: public employment is an instrument that can do all of the above: creating jobs at scale in the short term while markets recover, and creating social value in the process.
tgt_text: ntirho wa mfumo i xitirho lexi xi nga endlaka hinkwaswo leswi nga laha henhla: ku tumbuluxa mitirho hi xikalu eka nkarhi wo koma loko timakete ti ri karhi ti hlakarhela, na ku tumbuluxa nkoka wa vanhu loko ku ri karhi ku endliwa swoleswo.

src_text: the example is often cited of the massive public works programme undertaken by the united states after the great depression in the 1930s.
tgt_text: xikombiso lexi xi tala ku tshahiwa hi nongonoko wa mitirho ya mfumo lowukulu lowu endliweke hi united states endzhaku ka ku wa ikhonomi lokukulu hi va1930.

src_text: this was not just a stimulus, but also promoted social participation and inclusion.
tgt_text: lexi a ku ngo va ntsena xihlohloteri, kambe swi tlhele swi kondletela vutekaxiave bya vanhu na nkatsahinkwao.

src_text: there are several examples of innovative public employment programmes in the developing world, including in india, ethiopia and here in south africa.
tgt_text: ku na swikombiso swo talanyana swa minongonoko ya mitirho ya mfumo ya maendlelo lamantshwa eka misava leyi hluvukaka, ku katsa india, ethiopia na kwala afrikadzonga.

src_text: these programmes make a direct investment in local economies, reaching poorer areas first, supporting local small enterprises and trickling up into the wider economy from there.
tgt_text: minongonoko leyi yi endla vuvekisi byo kongoma eka tiikhonomi ta laha kaya, yi fikelela tindhawu leti nga swela ku sungula, yi seketela mabindzu lamatso ngo ma laha kaya na khuluke la eka ikhonomi yo angarhela kusuka kwalaho.

src_text: they also promote social participation and inclusion, providing communities with the means to change their lives as they undertake new forms of work.
tgt_text: yi tlhela yi kondletela vutekaxiave bya vanhu na nkatsa hinkwavo, yi nyika miganga tindlela to cinca vutomi bya vona tanihiloko va endla mixaka yintshwa ya ntirho.

src_text: in doing so, they contribute to transformation both at a local level and within broader society.
tgt_text: hi ku endla tano, yi hoxa xandla eka ncinco havumbirhi eka levhele ya le mugangeni na le rixakeni hi ku angarhela.

src_text: direct public investment to support employment and create economic opportunities that generate social value does more than just tackle the unemployment crisis.
tgt_text: vuvekisi bya vanhu byo kongoma ku seketela ntirho na ku tumbuluxa swivandlanene swa ikhonomi leswi swi endlaka nkoka wa vanhu byi endla swo tala kutlula ku ti rhana na xirilo xa mpfumaleko wa mitirho.

src_text: it is responsive, because it uses the state’s resources to respond to local community needs, be it for greener spaces, food security, more early childhood development centres, or for better and more accessible roads.
tgt_text: bya angula, hikuva byi tirhisa swipfuno swa mfumo ku angula eka swidingo swa miganga ya laha tikweni, hambi ku ri eka tindhawu ta swa mbangu, nsirhelelo wa swakudya, tisenthara ta nhluvukiso wa tindzumulo to tala, kumbe eka magondzo yo antswa na ku va yo fikeleleka swinene.

src_text: it is progressive, because it offers social protection and income security to those who face destitution because they are unable to find work.
tgt_text: byi ya emahlweni, hikuva byi nyika nsirhelelo wa vanhu na nhlayiso wa malinghena eka lavaya va langutanaka na vusweti hikuva va tsandzeka ku kuma ntirho.

src_text: it is an investment in the future, in that it supports the broader economic recovery agenda by urgently getting our people to work on improving our national and municipal infrastructure.
tgt_text: i vuvekisi eka vumundzuku, hikuva byi seketela ajenda ya nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi yo angarhela hi ku yisa vanhu vaka hina entirhweni hi ku hatlisa eka ku antswisa swimakiwakulu swa rixaka na swa masipala.

src_text: through the interventions in the stimulus, we are creating work for those who need it, while leaving a lasting impact on entire communities.
tgt_text: hikwalaho ka miphalalo leyi nga eka xihlohloteri lexi, hi le ku tumbuluxeni ka ntirho wa lavaya va wu dingaka, loko hi ri karhi hi siya nkhumbo wa nkarhi wo leha eka miganga hinkwayo.

src_text: like public employment programmes across the world, this employment stimulus supports and complements the critical role of the private sector in creating jobs.
tgt_text: ku fana na minongonoko ya mitirho ya mfumo emisaveni hinkwayo, xihlohloteri lexa mitirho xi seketela na ku pfuneta xiave lexa nkoka swo nghasi xa sekitara yo ka yi nga ri ya mfumo eka ku tumbuluxa mitirho.

src_text: it is countercyclical, in that as the recovery advances, the scale of public employment will decline.
tgt_text: yi hambana na swa ntolovelo, hikuva tanihiloko nhlakarhelo wu ya emahlweni, xikalu xa ntirho wa mfumo xa hunguteka.

src_text: the work experience and skills acquired by beneficiaries of the presidential employment stimulus will improve their prospects of securing formal employment.
tgt_text: ntokoto na swikili leswi kumiwaka hi vavuyeriwa va xihlohloteri xa mitirho xa phuresidente xi ta antswisa mikoteko ya vona eka ku kuma ntirho wa ximfumo.

src_text: the experience gained is also a pathway to entrepreneurial activity.
tgt_text: ntokoto lowu kumiweke wu tlhela wu va ndlela yo ya eka nghingiriko wa swa vun'wamabindzu.

src_text: participants will improve their skills and capabilities to start their own businesses, and can use the steady income provided by public employment to branch out into other incomegenerating activities.
tgt_text: vatekaxiave va ta antswisa swikili na vuswikoti bya vona ku sungula mabindzu ya vona vini, naswona va nga kota ku tirhisa malinghena leya nkarhi na nkarhi leyi nyikiwaka hi ntirho wa mfumo ku nghena eka migingiriko yin'wana yo endla malinghena.

src_text: i have consistently affirmed that the covid19 crisis is also a window of opportunity to build back better.
tgt_text: ndzi tiyisisile hi ndlela yo fanana leswaku xirilo xa covid19 i fasitere ra xivandla nene xa ku aka nakambe ku antswa.

src_text: at this time of great upheaval, we would be doing ourselves no favours by making unrealistic promises that raise expectations, only to come short when they are not met.
tgt_text: eka nkarhi lowu hinkwawo wa nkavanyeto lowukulu, hi ta va hi nga ti endleli swa kahle loko hi endla switshe mbiso swo ka swi nga hume leriseki leswi swi tlakusaka ku langutela, ntsena ku tlhela hi kayivela loko swi nga humeleli.

src_text: this is why each of the jobs and livelihood support interventions is fully funded, with a clear implementation plan.
tgt_text: leswi hi swona swi endlaka leswaku wun'wana na wun'wana wa mitirho leyi na miphalalo ya nseketelo wa vutihanyisi swi nyikiwa timali hi ku hetiseka, hi kungu ra nsimeko leri nga erivaleni.

src_text: the employment stimulus is not about vague commitments for some time in the future, but about jobs being created right here and now.
tgt_text: xihlohloteri lexa mitirho a xi hi mayelana na vutiboheleri byo ka byi nga twisiseki eka nkarhinyana lowu taka, kambe xi hi mayelana na ku tumbuluxiwa ka mitirho eka nkarhi wa sweswi.

src_text: the stimulus is the result of extensive consultation with national departments, provinces and metros to rapidly design employment pro grammes that can be rolled out or expanded within six months.
tgt_text: xihlohloteri lexi i mbuyelo wa ku burisana ko angarhela swinene na tindzawulo ta rixaka, ta swifundzakulu na ta madorobakulu ku tumbuluxa hi ku hatlisa minongonoko ya mitirho leyi yi nga simekiwaka kumbe ku ndlandlamuxiwa ku nga si hundza tin'hweti ta tsevu.

src_text: the implementing departments and other stakeholders were rigorously assessed on their capacity to implement.
tgt_text: tindzawulo to tirhisa na vakhomaxiave van'wana swi kambisisiwile hi vukheta eka vuswikoti bya swona bya ku tirhisa.

src_text: in every one of the programmes that fall under the stimulus, opportunities will be widely advertised and recruitment will be fair, open and transparent.
tgt_text: eka wun'wana na wun'wana wa minongonoko leyi yi welaka ehansi ka xihlohloteri lexi, swivandlanene swi ta navetisiwa naswona ku thola swi ta va leswinene, swo pfuleka na ku tlhela swi va erivaleni.

src_text: the goals we have set ourselves are realistic, measura ble and achievable, and draw lessons from past experience and international best prac tice.
tgt_text: swikongomelokulu leswi hi nga tivekela swona swi humeleriseka, swa pimeka na ku fikeleleka, naswona hi nga dyondza kusuka eka ntokoto wa nkarhi lowu nga hundza na maendlelo ya kahle ya matiko ya misava.

src_text: our people are ready and willing to work.
tgt_text: vanhu va ka hina va lulamerile naswona va tsakela ku tirha.

src_text: this vast potential must be harnessed, and our collective skills and capabilities brought to bear in rebuilding our country in the wake of the coronavirus.
tgt_text: vuswikoti lebyo hambanahambana byi boheka ku tirhisiwa, na swikili swa nhlanganelo na vuswikoti swi tirhisiwa eka ku aka hi vu ntshwa tiko ra ka hina eka ku tumbuluka ka khoronavhayirasi.

src_text: the presidential employment stimulus provides a respite for families who have endured a long hard winter with greatly reduced income, and for individuals who have spent many years without work.
tgt_text: xihlohloteri xa mitirho xa phuresidente xi nyika ku wisanyana eka mindyangu leyi yi nga tiyisela vuxika byo tika no leha hi malinghena leyi hungutiweke swinene, na le ka vanhu hi un’weun’we lava va nga tshama malembe yo tala va nga tirhi.

src_text: real, decent work is the right of every human being.
tgt_text: ntirho wa kahle, wa xiviri i mfanelo ya munhu un'wana na un'wana.

src_text: it is a precondition for economic growth and social stability.
tgt_text: i xipimelo lexi rhangeke emahlweni xa ku kula ka ikhonomi na ntshamiseko wa vanhu.

src_text: by giving effect to this fundamental right, the presidential employment stimulus is making a decisive contribution to building a society that works.
tgt_text: ku hlohlotela ikhonomi leyi tirhaka vukuzenzele unnamed nsimeko wa xi hlohloteri xa miti rho xa phure sidente vhiki leri nga hu ndza swi fungha ku cinca ka nkoka eka endlelo ra hina ro tirhana na ku pfumaleka ka mitirho.

src_text: recovery on the horizon for sa vukuzenzele unnamed the jacaranda trees are in full bloom across the nation’s capital, heralding the start of summer.
tgt_text: nhlakarhelo wa vonaka evugimamusi bya afrikadzonga vukuzenzele unnamed mijakaranda yi le ku balekeni swi luva hi vutalo entsindza wa tiko, yi komba masungulo ya ximumu.

src_text: after a long and difficult winter, the beginning of a new season should fill us with optimism.
tgt_text: endzhaku ka xixika lexo leha na ku tika, masungulo ya nguva yintshwa ya hi xarha hi ntshembo wa leswi nene.

src_text: when the national state of disaster was declared in march, our immediate priority was to contain the spread of the virus and provide emergency relief to citizens, communities, workers and businesses.
tgt_text: loko xiyimo xa rixaka xa mhangu xi tivisiwa hi nyenyankulu, xirhangana xa hina xa xihatla a ku ri ku kamanyeta ku hangalaka ka xitsongwatsongwana lexi na ku nyika mphalalo wa xilamulelamhangu eka vaaka tiko, miganga, vatirhi na ma bindzu.

src_text: over the course of eight months and with the support of our social partners, we rolled out a comprehensive set of measures to limit the social and economic impact of the pandemic.
tgt_text: eku fambeni ka nhungu wa tin'hweti na hi nseketelo wa vatirhisani lava nga na xi nakulobye, hi simeke xikatsa xo katsakanya xa magoza ku hunguta nkhumbo wa vanhu na ikhonomi wa ntungukulu lowu.

src_text: we massively expanded social protection on a scale that has never been attempted before in this country.
tgt_text: hi ndlandlamukise hi mpimo lowukulu nsirhelelo wa vanhu hi xikalu lexi xi nga si tshamaka xi ringetiwa etikweni leri.

src_text: we are one of the few countries in the world where the right of access to social security is enshrined in the constitution, and we can be proud that during this grave crisis we gave practical expression to this right in many ways.
tgt_text: hi rin'wana ra matiko mangarimangani emisaveni laha mfanelo ya mfikelelo wa nsirhelelo wa vaaki wu sirheleriweke eka vumbiwa, naswona hi nga tinyungubyisa leswaku hi nkarhi wa xirilo lexi hi hume lerise mfanelo leyi hi tindlela to tala.

src_text: in addition to our existing social grants, which reach more than 17 million people every month, we toppedup the old age, disability and child support grants.
tgt_text: hi ku engetela eka timali ta nhlayiso wa vaaki leti nga kona, hi fikelela kutlula 17 wa timiliyoni ta vanhu n'hweti yin'wana na yin'wana, hi enge tele midende ya vadyuhari, vatsoniwa na vana.
