src_text: wasaa has acquired all the terminal’s moveable assets and a 20 percent share in berthtoterminal pipelines.
tgt_text: wasaa yi kumile rifuwo leri fambisiwaka ra xitichi hinkwaro na 20% ta nkavelo eka tiphayiphi to fambisa kusuka evukhu ngelweni kufika exitichini.

src_text: with the 2020 report by the broadbased black economic empowerment commission showing that most economic sectors are falling short of their black women ownership targets, this acquisition by a black and femaleowned company of a liquid fuel terminal is a historic development.
tgt_text: hi xiviko xa 2020 hi khomixini ya havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vantima wo angarhela lexi kombaka leswaku tisekitara ta ikhonomi to tala ta kayivela eka swikongomisiwa swa vun'wini bya vavasati va vantima, makumelo lama hi khamphani leyi nga ehansi ka vun'wini bya wa ntima wa xisati wa xitichi xa mafurha ya xihalaki hi leswi humelelaka leswi nga swa nkoka eka matimu.

src_text: it contributes to our national effort to redress inequality and ensure there is meaningful participation by the country’s majority in our economy.
tgt_text: swi hoxa xandla eka matshalatshala ya hina ya rixaka ku lulamisa nkalandzingano na ku tiyisisa leswaku ku na vutekaxiave byo tivikana hi vunyingi bya tiko eka ikhonomi ya hina.

src_text: recently, i announced the appointment of the new broadbased black economic empowerment advisory council, which comprises government, business, labour and other stakeholders.
tgt_text: ku nga ri khale ngopfu, ndzi tivise ku thoriwa ka khansele yo tsundzuxa ya havexerisama timba wa ikhonomi ya vantima wo angarhela leyintshwa, leyi yi vumbiwaka hi mfumo, mabindzu, vatirhi na vakhomaxiave van'wana.

src_text: it was established to champion the cause of economic transformation.
tgt_text: yi tumbuluxeriwile ku sirhelela xivangelo xa ncinco wa ikhonomi.

src_text: the council has its origins in a 2001 report produced by the bee commission.
tgt_text: khansele leyi yi na timitsu ta yona eka xiviko xa 2001 lexi humesiweke hi khomixini ya bee.

src_text: this report emanated from an extensive study into the structure of the south african economy, and what was needed to transform the economy, grow black entrepreneurship, ensure greater black management and ownership of busines ses, and bring black women into the mainstream of the economy.
tgt_text: xiviko lexi xi tumbuluke kusuka eka ndzavisiso wo angarhela eka xivumbeko xa ikhonomi ya afrikadzonga, na leswi a swi dingiwa ku cinca ikhonomi leyi, ku kurisa vun'wamabindzu bya vantima, ku tiyisisa leswaku ku na vufambisi na vun'wini bya vantima bya mabindzu, na ku tisa vavasati va vantima eka ntolovelo wa ikhonomi.

src_text: next year, it will be two decades since the broadbased black economic empowerment (bbbee) act – which established the council – was passed.
tgt_text: haxawa, ku ta va ku ri ma lembexikhume mambirhi ya nawu wa havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vantima wo angarhela (bbbee) – lowu wu tumbuluxeke khansele leyi – wu pasisiwile.

src_text: our commitment to entrench and deepen economic empowerment is unwavering.
tgt_text: vutiboheleri bya hina i ku tiyisa na ku entisa havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi lowu nga tsekatsekiki.

src_text: that is why black economic empowerment is an integral part of our economic reconstruction and recovery in the wake of the covid19 pandemic.
tgt_text: leswi hi swona swi endlaka leswaku havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vantima wu va xiphemu xa nkoka lexi famba ka swin'we xa ku aka ka hina hi vuntshwa na nhlakarhelo wa ikhonomi loko ku tumbulukile ntungukulu wa covid19.

src_text: this is one of the reassurances i articulated to the black business council earlier last month, where we discussed the state of bbbee in the country, the progress that has been made and what we need to do as a collective to build on our gains.
tgt_text: lebyi hi byin'wana bya vuti yisisi lebyi ndzi byi hlamuseleke eka khansele ya mabindzu ya vantima ekusunguleni ka n'hweti leyi nga hela, laha hi kaneleke xiyimo xa bbbee etikweni, ndzima leyi khatsiweke na leswi hi dingaka ku swi endla tanihi nhlanganelo ku aka ehenhla ka swikumiwa swa hina.

src_text: while there has been significant progress over the last two decades, there are some areas where there has been regression.
tgt_text: ku tlhele ku va na ndzima yo tivikana eka malembexikhume mambirhi lama nga hundza, ku na swiyenge laha ku veke na ku tlhelela endzhaku.

src_text: we have gone backwards when it comes to increasing black management control, upscaling skills development, entrenching enterprise deve lopment and broadening procurement to give opportunities to black women and the youth.
tgt_text: hi tlhelerile endzhaku loko swi ta eka ku engetela ka vulawuri bya vufambisi bya vantima, ku antswisa nhluvukiso wa swikili, ku tiyisa nhluvukiso wa mabindzu na ku ndlandla mukisiwa maxavelo ya tinhundzu na vukorhokeri ku nyika swivandlanene eka vavasati na vantshwa va vantima.

src_text: the apartheid government deliberately built a distorted economy designed to benefit white people.
tgt_text: mfumo wa xihlawuhlawu wu akile hi vomu ikhonomi leyi xandziweke leyi endleriweke ku vuyerisa valungu.

src_text: the majority of south africans were marginalised from the mainstream economy, with black entrepreneurs confined to small retail industries in the townships.
tgt_text: vunyingi bya vanhu va afrikadzonga a va tsan'wiwile eka ikhonomi ya ntolovelo, laha van'wamabindzu va vantima va pfaleriweke eka tiindasitiri ta vuxavisi letitsongo emalokixini.

src_text: at the end of apartheid, black ownership of jselisted companies was less than 1 percent.
tgt_text: emakumu ka mfumo wa xihlawuhlawu, vun'wini bya vantima bya tikhamphani leti xaxametiweke eka jse a byi ri ehansi ka phesente yin'we.

src_text: this figure has not improved much in the past 28 years.
tgt_text: nhlayo leyi a yi antswangi ngopfu eka 28 wa malembe lama nga hundza.

src_text: at the same time, there have been important private sector initiatives and deliberate measures by the state to facilitate greater and more meaningful participation of black people in the economy.
tgt_text: hi nkarhi wun'we, ku vile na mapfhumba ya tisekitara leti nga riki ta mfumo ya nkoka na magoza ya vomu hi mfumo ku humelerisa vutekaxiave lebyikulukumba na ku va na nkoka swinene bya vantima eka ikhonomi.

src_text: between 2017 and 2020, nearly 500 empowerment transactions were submitted for registration to the bbbee commission.
tgt_text: exikarhi ka 2017 na 2020, kwalomu ka 500 ya mixaviselano ya havexerisamatimba yi rhumeriwile ku ya tsarisiwa eka khomixini ya bbbee.

src_text: in key sectors such as construction, property, information and communications technology, tourism and transport, black ownership has exceeded targets.
tgt_text: eka tisekitarakulu to tanihi vuaki, miako, thekinoloji ya vuxokoxoko na vuhlanganisi, vupfhumba na vutleketli na vun'wini bya vantima byi hundzisile swikongomisiwa.

src_text: economic transformation and economic growth are intertwined.
tgt_text: ncinco wa ikhonomi na ku kula ka ikhonomi swa fambisana.

src_text: there cannot be one without the other.
tgt_text: a ku nge vi na xin'we lexin'wana xi nga ri kona.

src_text: by integrating transformation into the process of industrialisation, we are advancing a more inclusive growth model that shares, rather than concentrates, wealth.
tgt_text: hi ku pfanganisa ncinco eka phurosese ya ku endla tifeme, hi ta antswisa ndzetelo wa ku kula lowu katsaka hinkwavo swinene lowu wu avelanaka rifuwo, handle ko ri hlengeleta.

src_text: the department of trade, industry and competition (dtic) is pursuing this goal through various programmes.
tgt_text: ndzawulo ya mabindzu, vumaki na mphikizano (dtic) yi le ku hlongoriseni ka xikongomelokulu xa yona hi ku tirhisa minongoloko yo hambanahambana.

src_text: they include a support programme for township businesses, exportrelated training by the industrial development corporation (idc) to black, women and youthowned businesses, and increased infrastructure budget to smmes in the tshwane special economic zone.
tgt_text: yi katsa nseketelo wa nongoloko wa nseketelo wa mabindzu ya le malokixini, vuleteri lebyi yelanaka na ku rhumeriwa ka tinhundzu ematikweni mambe hi nhlangano wa nhluvukiso wa tifeme eka mabindzu lama nga ehansi ka vun'wini bya vantshwa na vavasati, va vantima, na mpimanyeto wa switirhisiwakulu lowu tlakusiweke eka tismme leti nga eka zoni ya ikhonomi yo hlawuleka ya tshwane.

src_text: through sectoral masterplans we are driving localisation that benefits black owned businesses.
tgt_text: hi ku tirhisa makungukulu ya tisekitara hi le ku susumeteni ka ku endliwa ka swa laha tikweni leswi swi vuyerisaka mabindzu lama nga ehansi ka vun'wini bya vantima.

src_text: for example, 10 black contract growers have been established with an investment of r336 million as part of the poultry masterplan.
tgt_text: tanihi xikombiso, 10 ra varimi va tikontiraka va vantima va tumbuluxiwile va ri na vuvekisi bya r336 wa timiliyoni tanihi xiphemu xa kungukulu ra vufuwahuku.

src_text: government has also launched a black exporters network that will connect blackowned companies in food, engineering products, auto components, beauty products and other sectors of the economy.
tgt_text: mfumo wu tlhele wu simeka netiweke ya varhumeli va tinhundzu na vukorhokeri ematikweni mambe va vantima leyi yi nga ta hlanganisa tikhamphani leti nga ehansi ka vun'wini bya vantima eka swakudya, swimakiwa swa vuinjhiniyara, tiphati ta mimovha, swimakiwa swa vuxongi na tisekitara tin'wana ta ikhonomi.

src_text: as part of our drive to create a new generation of black industrialists, last year government approved r2.5 billion in new support to about 180 black industrialists in the form of loans from the idc and national empowerment fund (nef) and grants from the dtic incentive scheme.
tgt_text: tanihi xiphemu xa pfhumba ra hina ra ku tumbuluxa rixaka rintshwa ra van'watifeme va vantima, n'wexemu mfumo wu pasise r2.5 wa tibiliyo ni eka nseketelo wuntshwa eka kwalomu ka 180 wa van'watifeme va vantima hi xivumbeko xa swikweleti kusuka eka idc na nkwama wa havexerisamatimba wa rixaka (nef) na timalimpfuneto kusuka eka xikimi xa swihlohloteri xa dtic.

src_text: over the next three years a further r21 billion has been committed by the idc, nef and other institutions to support black industrialists.
tgt_text: eka malembe manharhu lama taka r21 wa tibiliyoni to yisa emahlweni ti tibohiwile hi idc, nef na mihlangano yin'wana ku seketela van'watifeme va vantima.

src_text: an additional r25 billion has been committed to support black, women, youth and workerowned companies.
tgt_text: r25 wa tibiliyoni to engetela ti bohiwile ku seketela tikhamphani leti nga ehansi ka vun'wini bya vavasati, vantshwa na vatirhi va vantima.

src_text: it is clear that much more work needs to be done to address the many challenges that black businesses face.
tgt_text: swi le rivaleni leswaku ntirho wo tala wu dinga ku endliwa ku tirhana na mitlho ntlho yo tala leyi mabindzu ya vantima ma langutanaka na yona.

src_text: this includes the difficulty of accessing startup and expansion capital and the ability of smmes to find markets for their products.
tgt_text: leswi swi katsa ku tikeriwa ku fikelela xumakulu xo sungula bindzu na xo ndlandlamukisa na vuswikoti bya tismme ku kuma timakete ta swimakiwa swa tona.

src_text: black womenowned businesses, in particular, encounter difficulties in taking on largescale empowerment transactions.
tgt_text: mabindzu lama nga ehansi ka vun'wini bya vavasati va vantima, ngopfungopfu, ya hlangana na ku tikeriwa eka ku tirhana na mixaviselano ya havexerisamatimba wa mpimo lowukulu.

src_text: breaking the cycle of underdevelopment through black economic empowerment is not just a moral imperative; it also makes business sense.
tgt_text: ku tshova ndzhendzeleko wa nhluvukiso wa xiyimo xa le hansi hi ku tirhisa havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vantima a ko va ntsena leswi nga na nkoka swa vumunhu; swi tlhela swi va na mongo wa xibindzu.

src_text: the continued exclusion of the black majority from the economy’s mainstream constrains economic growth, which ultimately impacts all business.
tgt_text: ku siyiwa ehandle loku yaka emahlweni ka vunyingi bya vantima eka ntolovelo wa ikhonomi swi kamanyeta ku kula ka ikhonomi, leswi ekuheteleleni swi khumbaka mabindzu hinkwawo.

src_text: expanding the country’s entrepreneurial base is fundamental to growth.
tgt_text: ku ndlandlamukisa tshaku ra mabindzu ra tiko i swa nkoka swonghasi eka ku kula.

src_text: we have a shared responsibility to drive the effort to entrench bbbee because it is about eradicating inequality.
tgt_text: hi na vutihlamuleri lebyi avelaniwaka ku susumeta matshalatshala ya ku tiyisa bbbee hikuva yi hi mayelana na ku herisa nkalandzingano.

src_text: unequal economies breed unequal societies, and unequal societies don’t grow and flourish.
tgt_text: tiikhonomi leti nga ringaniki ti tswala tinxaka leti nga ringaniki, naswona tinxaka leti nga ringaniki a ti kuli naswona a ti nyuki.

src_text: it is not only wrong, but also unsustainable, for businesses to keep their management and ownership structures mostly white or male.
tgt_text: a swi lo hoxeka ntsena, kambe a swi yiseki ema hlweni, eka mabindzu ku hla yisa swivumbeko swa wona swa vufambisi na swa vun'wini ngopfungopfu leswi nga swa valungu kumbe swa vaxinuna.

src_text: it is, after all, the south african public that are the primary consumers of their goods and services.
tgt_text: endzhaku ka hinkwaswo, i vaaki va afrikadzonga lava va nga vatirhisinkulu va tinhu ndzu na vukorhokeri.

src_text: this should be reflected in diversity of hiring and management practices, in ownership and in procurement.
tgt_text: leswi swi faneleke ku kombisiwa eka ku hambana ka maendlelo ya ku thola na ya vufambisi, eka vun'wini na le ka ku xaviwa ka tinhundzu na vukorhokeri.

src_text: broadbased black economic empowerment will only be achieved through partnership and a shared commitment to transformation.
tgt_text: havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vantima wo angarhela a wu nga fikeleriwi ntsena hi ku tirhisa xinakulobye na vutiboheleri lebyi avelaniwaka eka ncinco.

src_text: the appointment of the new bbbee council will help us to expand the frontiers of broadbased black economic empowerment.
tgt_text: ku thoriwa ka khansele ya bbbee leyintshwa swi ta hi pfuna ku ndlandlamukisa mavuthu ya havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vantima wo angarhela.

src_text: i call on business, labour and industry to work with the council as it undertakes this vital work.
tgt_text: havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vantima (bee) wa boha eka ku kula vukuzenzele unnamed hi dzivamisoko lembe leri, nxaviselano wa havexerisamatimba wa ikhonomi ya vantima wo angarhela wa nkoka swonghasi wu fikeleriwile ekapavuhuma dyambu lowu wu antswisaka hi ndlela yo tivikana vutekaxiave bya mabindzu lama nga ehansi ka vun'wini bya vantima eka sekitara ya eneji.

src_text: rising cost of living calls for a united response over the past few months, south african consumers have been hit by steep price increases that have dramatically affected their quality of life.
tgt_text: ndhurho lowu tlakuka waku hanya wu koxa angulo lowu nga na vun’we kutlula tin'hweti tingaritingani, vatirhisi va laha afrikadzonga va tlumbiwile hi ku tlakuka ka mixavo lokukulu loku ku khumbeke hi mpimo wa le henhla risima ra vutomi bya vona.

src_text: it has become increasingly more expensive to buy food and other essentials, to pay for basic services and to use public or private transportation.
tgt_text: se swi durha swinene hi ndlela leyi tlakukeke ku xava swakudya na switirhisiwa swin’wana swa nkoka, ku hakelela vukorhokeri bya masungulo na ku tirhisa vutleketli bya mani na mani kumbe lebyi nga riki bya mfumo.

src_text: while these rising costs affect everyone, lowincome households are feeling them the most.
tgt_text: loko midurho leyi tlakukaka ya ha khumba un’wana na un’wana, miti leyi kumaka mali ya le hansi hi yona yi swi twaka swinene.

src_text: the latest consumer price index for april 2022 published by stats sa shows there has been little respite for hardpressed south africans.
tgt_text: xikombo xa mixavo ya vatirhisi xo hetelela xa dzivamisoko 2022 lexi humesiweke hi stats sa xi komba leswaku ku vile na ku wisa kutsongo eka ku tikeriwa ka maafrikadzonga.

src_text: food inflation was recorded at 6.2 per cent.
tgt_text: inifulexini ya swakudya yi kandziyisiwile eka 6.2 wa tiphesente.

src_text: the most basic foodstuffs cost more than a year ago, with staples like cooking oil recording the highest increases.
tgt_text: swakudya swa masungulo swo tala swi durha kutlula leswi a swi ri xiswona lembe leri nga hundza, loko swakudya swa masiku hinkwawo swo fana na oyili yo sweka swi kandziyisile mitlakuko ya le henhla swinene.

src_text: the price of fuel, which affects the price of almost everything else, has risen by a third in the twelve months to march 2022. south africa is not alone in this regard.
tgt_text: nxavo wa mafurha, lowu khumbaka nxavo wa xilo xin’wana na xin’wana xo karhi, wu tlakukile hi xanharhu eka khumembirhi wa tin'hweti kufika eka nyenyakulu 2022. afrikadzonga a yi yoxe eka leswi.

src_text: a recently published poll for the world economic forum shows that nearly a quarter of people globally, including those in developed economies, are struggling financially due to rising prices.
tgt_text: nhlawulo lowu nga va kona sweswinyana wa foramu ya ikhomomi ya misava wu komba leswaku kwalomu ka kotara ya vanhu va misava hinkwayo, ku katsa na lava nga eka tiikhonomi leta ha kulaka, va le ku tikeriweni hi timali hikwalaho ka ntlakuko wa mixavo.

src_text: these increases, particularly the price of fuel, are the consequence of events over which we have little control.
tgt_text: mitlakuko leyi, ngopfungopfu nxavo wa mafurha, i switandzhaku swa swiendleko leswi hi nga ni vulawuri byitsongo eka swona.

src_text: the ongoing conflict between russia and ukraine has had a significant impact on the price of fuel and food.
tgt_text: ntlimbo lowu yaka emahlweni exikarhi ka russia na ukraine wu vile na nkhumbo wo tivikana eka nxavo wa mafurha na swakudya.

src_text: both countries are major exporters to international markets of fertilisers, grains and oilseeds that are needed for a range of items such as cooking oil.
tgt_text: matiko hamambirhi i varhumelinkulu va tinhundzu na vukorhokeri ematikweni mambe eka timakete ta matiko ya misava ta manyoro, swakudya swo tanihi tinyawa na tinyungu ta oyili leti lavekaka eka switirhisiwa swo hamhanahambana swo fana na oyili yo sweka.

src_text: another factor is lower agricultural output due to extreme weather events caused by climate change, such as flooding and droughts.
tgt_text: xiphemu xin’wana i vuhumelerisi bya le hansi bya vurimi hikwalaho ka swiendleko swa maxelo yo hisa kutlula mpimo leswi vangiwaka hi ku cinca ka maxelo, swo tanihi mikhukhulo na dyandza.

src_text: while many of these events are beyond our control, government is doing what it can to shield the south african from current and future price increases.
tgt_text: loko swo tala swa swiendleko leswi hi nga riki na vulawuri ehenhla ka swona, mfumo wu le ku endleni hilaha wu nga kotaka hi kona ku sirhelela maafrika dzonga eka mitlakuko ya mixavo ya nkarhi wa sweswi na lowu taka.

src_text: one of our greatest advantages as a country is a strong, independent reserve bank that has managed to keep inflation within a narrow target range, well below what many other countries are experiencing.
tgt_text: xin’wana xa swiyimonene swa hina leswikulumba swinene tanihi tiko i bangikulu leyi tiyimelaka, yo tiya leyi koteke ku endla inifulexini yi tshama yi ri endzeni ka vunavi bya mpakaniso wo lala, ehansi swinene ka leswi matiko man’wana yo tala ya nga eku hlanganeni na swona.

src_text: we recently announced that the fuel levy will be suspended for another two months to august, which will bring some relief to households.
tgt_text: sweswinyana hi tivisile leswaku xibalo xa mafurha xi ta yimisiwanyana ku ringana tin’hweti timbirhi tin’wana kufika mhawuri, leswi nga ta tisa mphalalo emitini.

src_text: the suspension of the levy has provided essential relief to south africans since it began in april.
tgt_text: ku yimisiwanyana ka xibalo lexi swi nyikile mphalalo wa nkoka eka maafrikadzonga kusukela emasunguleni ya dzivamisoko.

src_text: since the suspension of the levy comes at a significant cost to public finances, which affects other programmes of government, it will be difficult to continue this indefinitely.
tgt_text: tanihileswi ku yimisiwanyana ka xibalo swi taka na ndhurho wo tivikana eka timali ta mfumo, leswi swi khumbaka minongoloko yin’wana ya mfumo, swi ta tika ku yisa leswi emahlweni nkarhi wo leha.

src_text: there are, however, other things we can do.
tgt_text: hambiswiritano, ku na swin’wana hi nga ta swi endla.

src_text: improving our nation’s food security is vital to withstanding this and future shocks.
tgt_text: ku antswisa nsirhelelo wa swakudya wa rixaka ra ka hina i swa nkoka ku kota ku kondzelela leswi na swihlamariso swa nkarhi lowu taka.

src_text: we have a strong agricultural sector that continues to grow and create jobs.
tgt_text: hi na sekitara ya vurimi yo tiya leyi yi yaka emahlweni na ku kula na ku tumbuluxa mitirho.

src_text: to further increase agricultural production and strengthen our food sovereignty, we are investing heavily in improving local capacity, supporting commercial and smallscale farmers alike and helping more people to grow their own food.
tgt_text: ku engetela ku yisa mahlweni vuhumelerisi bya vurimi na ku tiyisa vutilawuri bya hina bya swakudya, hi le ku vekiseni swinene eka ku kurisa vuswikoti bya kwala tikweni, hi seketela van’wamapurasi va xibindzu na va mpimo lowutsongo hi ndlela yo fana na ku pfuna vanhu vo tala ku kurisa swakudya swa vona vini.

src_text: through the presidential employment stimulus, input vouchers have been given to over 65,000 smallholder farmers, and work is underway to reach 250,000 such farmers.
tgt_text: hi ku tirhisa xihlohloteri xa mitirho xa phuresidente, tivhawuchara ta manyoro ti nyikiwile kutlula 65,000 wa van’wamapurasi va mpimo lowutsongo, naswona ntirho wu le ku endliweni ku fikelela 250,000 wa van’wamapurasi valava.

src_text: government is also providing subsistence farmers with fertilisers and equipment to produce food, and helping groups or individuals to start their own food gardens.
tgt_text: mfumo wu tlhela wu nyika van’wamapurasi lava tifuyelaka swifuwo na ku byala matsavu va nga xavisi manyoro na switirhisiwa ku humelerisa swakudya, na ku pfuna mitlawa kumbe vanhu ku sungula swirhapa swa swakudya swa vona vini.

src_text: in provinces like north west, smallscale farmers are supported with agricultural ‘starterpacks’ of seedlings and poultry, in partnership with local agricultural colleges.
tgt_text: eka swifundzakulu swo fana na n’walunguvupeladyambu, van’wapurasi va mpimo lowutsongo va seketeriwa hi switirhisiwa swa vurimi swa ku byala swimilani na ku fuya tihuku, hi ku tirhisana na tikholichi ta vurimi ta ndhawu yaleyo.

src_text: through the proactive land acquisition strategy and the release of stateowned land for agriculture, we are supporting more smallscale farmers to expand their businesses and make them commercially successful.
tgt_text: hi ku tirhisa qhinga ro kuma misava ra mavonelamahlweni na ku humesiwa ka misava leyi nga ehansi ka vun’wini bya mfumo ku endla vurimi, hi le ku seketeleni ka van’wamapurasi va mpimo lowutsongo vo tala ku ndlandlamuxa mabindzu ya vona na ku ma endla leswaku ya nghenisa mali hi ndlela leyi humelelaka.

src_text: we are also focusing on establishing more publicprivate partnerships to support the expansion of black commercial farming through initiatives like the partners in agri land solutions and the agricultural development agency.
tgt_text: hi tlhela hi va hi ri eku languteni ka ku tumbuluxa swinakulobye leswi nga exikarhi ka mfumo na lava nga riki mfumo swo tala ku seketela ndlandlamukiso wa vurimi bya xibindzu bya vantima hi ku endla matshalatshala yo fana na vatirhisani eka switshunxo swa misava ya vurimi na ejensi ya nhluvukiso wa vurimi.

src_text: to enhance biosecurity and safeguard animal health against diseases like footandmouth, we are strengthening our animal movement control measures and vaccine production capabilities.
tgt_text: ku kurisa vusirheleri ehenhla swihanyi na tikhemikali ta swihanyi na ku sirhelela rihanyo ra swiharhi ehenhla ka mavabyi yo fana swindomundomu, hi le ku tiyiseni magoza ya hina ya vulawuri bya mfambafambo wa swiharhi na vuswikoti bya vuhumelerisi bya swisawutisi.

src_text: in addition to boosting local food production, our extensive social grants system and zerorating of basic goods helps to protect the poor from rising costs.
tgt_text: hi ku engetela ku tiyisa vuhumelerisi bya swakudya bya laha tikweni, maendlelo ya hina ya timalimpfuneto ta vaaki yo angarhela na mpimo wa xibalo wa ziro wa swakudya swa masungulo swi pfuna ku sirhelela lava nga swela eka midurho leyi tlakuka.

src_text: through free basic services like water and electricity for indigent households, we can ensure that no family goes without basic services.
tgt_text: hi vukorhokeri bya masungulo bya mahala byo fana na mati na gezi eka miti leyi nga swela, hi nga tiyisisa leswaku a ku na ndyangu lowu nga pfumalaka vukorhokeri bya masungulo.

src_text: to get through this difficult period, all of society should get involved.
tgt_text: ku hlula xiyimo lexo tika, miganga hinkwayo yi fanele ku tikatsa.

src_text: for our part, government will continue to monitor the situation closely and will do everything within its power to protect south africans from unsustainable increases in the cost of living.
tgt_text: eka xiphemu xa hina, mfumo wu ta ya emahlweni wu languta xiyimo lexi swinene naswona wu ta endla xin’wana na xin’wana hi matimba ya wona ku sirhelela maafikadzonga eka mitlakuko leyi nga yisekiki emahlweni eka ndhurho wa ku hanya.

src_text: corporate south africa should ensure that consumers do not pay more for food than they have to.
tgt_text: tikhaphanikulu ta afrika dzonga ti fanele ku tiyisisa leswaku vatirhisi a va hakeli ngopfu eka swakudya kutlula leswi va faneleke ku hakerisa xiswona.

src_text: we welcome the indications from food manufacturers and retailers that they are putting measures in place to help consumers get more for their money.
tgt_text: hi amukela swikoweto kusuka eka vaendli va swakudya na vaxavisi leswaku va le ku endleni ka matshalatshala ku pfuna vatirhisi ku kuma swo tala hi mali ya vona.

src_text: in march this year the competition commission released for public comment the terms of reference for a market enquiry into the fresh produce market.
tgt_text: hi nyenyakulu lembe leri khomixini ya mphikizano yi humesile vonelo ra mani na mani ra swipimelo swa vulavisisi bya makete eka makete wa swirin'wa swo tsakama.

src_text: it noted that the cost of fresh produce has been increasing at aboveinflation levels, and that this has had a disproportionate effect on the poor.
tgt_text: yi vonile leswaku ndhurho wa swirin’wa swo tsakama wu le ku gonyeni hi tilevhele leti nga henhla ka inifulexini, naswona leswi nga va na xitandzhaku lexi nga ringanelangiki eka vanhu lava nga swela.

src_text: the inquiry will examine if there are any distortions in the value chain that make food more expensive.
tgt_text: vulavisisi byi ta kambela loko ku ri na vuxisi byihi kumbe byihi eka mafambiselo leswi endlaka leswaku swakudya swi durha swinene.

src_text: we will use our competition policy to protect consumers against unjustifiable price increases and anticompetitive practices by businesses, as we did during the covid19 pandemic.
tgt_text: hi ta tirhisa pholisi ya hina ya mphikizano ku sirhelela vatirhisi ehenhla ka ku tlakuka ka mixavo loku nga seketelekiki na maendlelo lama lwisanaka na mphikizano hi mabindzu, tanihiloko hi endlile hi nkarhi wa ntungukulu wa covid19.

src_text: the ongoing process of structural reform of our economy will support these efforts.
tgt_text: endlelo leri yaka emahlweni ro cinca xivumbeko xa ikhonomi ya hina ri ta seketela matshalatshala lama.

src_text: reforms in the energy, transport and telecommunications sectors aim to reduce the cost of electricity, logistics and data in the long term through greater competition and efficiency.
tgt_text: ku cinca eka tisekitara ta eneji, vutleketli na sekitara ya vuhlanganisi bya tiqingho ku kongomisa eka ku hunguta ku durha ka gezi, vufambisi bya nhundzu na data eka nkarhi wo leha hi mphikizano wa le henhla na matirhelo lama nga tlangisiki swipfuno.

src_text: we should be paying less, not more, for these services in the future.
tgt_text: hi fanele hi nkarhi hi hakelela ehansi, ku nga ri swo tala, eka vukorhokeri eka nkarhi lowu taka.

src_text: though oil prices and extreme weather are events over which we have little control, there is still much we can do, as government, business, labour and communities to help the people of south africa through this difficult time.
tgt_text: ndhurho lowu tlakuka waku hanya wu koxa angulo lowu nga na vun’we kutlula tin'hweti tingaritingani, vatirhisi va laha afrikadzonga va tlumbiwile hi ku tlakuka ka mixavo lokukulu loku ku khumbeke hi mpimo wa le henhla risima ra vutomi bya vona.

src_text: our nation mourns the young lives lost in enyobeni tavern tragedy vukuzenzele unnamed a few weeks ago the families of a township in scenery park outside east london, received news that every parent prays they never get to hear.
tgt_text: tiko ra hina ri rilela vutomi bya vantshwa lebyi lahlekeke eka khombo ra le thavhenini ya le enyobeni vukuzenzele unnamed mavhiki mangarimangani lama hundzeke mindyangu ya le ndhawini ya scenery park ehandle ka east london, yi kumile mahungu lama mutswari un’wana na un’wana a khongelaka ku ka a nga pfuki a ma twile.

src_text: they were told that 21 of their children had been found dead, in a tavern.
tgt_text: va byeriwile leswaku 21 wa vana va vona va kumiwile va lovile, ethavhenini.

src_text: the youngest child was only 13 years old.
tgt_text: n’wana lontsongo a ri na 13 wa malembe ntsena.

src_text: the police investigation into the tragedy is proceeding apace.
tgt_text: vulavisisi bya maphorisa eka khombo byi ya mahlweni hi xihatla.

src_text: flowing from the investigations, the buffalo city metro is looking into whether the tavern violated any municipal regulations.
tgt_text: ku ya emahlweni ka kahle ka vulavisisi, masipala wa buffalo city wu le ku langutisiseni loko thavhene yi nga tlulanga nawu na wun’we wa masipala.

src_text: our thoughts and prayers are with the families who are struggling to come to terms with this unspeakable horror.
tgt_text: miehleketo na swikhongelo swa hina swi katsa mindyangu leyi nga ku xanisekeni ku fikelela ku amukela khombo ro chavisa leri nga vulavulekiki.

src_text: we commend the eastern cape provincial government for assisting the affected families, as well as avbob that has pledged to assist the families with the burials.
tgt_text: hi khensa mfumo wa xifundzakulu xa kapavuxa ku va wu pfuna mindyangu leyi khumbekeke, xikan’we na avbob leyi tinyiketeleke ku pfuna mindyangu ku lahla.

src_text: even as the relevant authorities deconstruct what happened to ensure there is justice for the victims, there is a conversation we do need to have as a country.
tgt_text: hambiloko milawu yo fanela yi hlela leswi humeleleke ku tiyisisa leswaku nawu wu teka xiave eka vatwisiwa ku vava, ku na mbhurisano lowu hi lavaka ku va na wona tanihi tiko.

src_text: it is the problem of underage drinking.
tgt_text: i xiphiqo xa ku nwa byala hi vana va malembe ya le hansi.

src_text: the footage and images posted online of the socalled ‘pens down’ party at the venue that night show revelling youngsters clutching bottles of alcohol.
tgt_text: mikandziyiso na swinepe leswi hoxiweke eka swa leswi vitaniwaka tlangu wa ‘pens down’ endhawini liya vusiku byebyo swi komba vantshwa va tsakile va karhi va bananisa mabondhlele ya byala.

src_text: many of those in the images look barely out of their teens.
tgt_text: votala va vona eka swinepe va languteka va ri lavantsongo.

src_text: a number of young people from scenery park have told the media of having seen a post circulated on social media, offering free rounds of alcohol to all who attended the event that night.
tgt_text: nhlayo ya vantshwa kusuka escenery park va byerile va vuteki bya mahungu leswaku va vone hungu ri rhendzeleka eka inthanete ya vuhangalasamahungu ya vanhu, ro nyikiwa byala bya mahala eka hinkwavo lava yeke etlangwini vusiku byebyo.

src_text: the increased social acceptability of young people drinking alcohol has become a serious problem in a country where the majority of the drinking population are already classified by the world health organization as binge drinkers.
tgt_text: ku engeteleka ka ku amukela hi vaaki ka ku nwa byala hi vantshwa i xiphiqo lexikulu etikweni laha vanhu vo tala lava nwaka byala va nga ntlawahatiwa hi nhlangano wa rihanyo wa misava leswaku i swidakwa.

src_text: alcohol use amongst adolescents is associated with impaired function, absenteeism from learning, alcoholrelated injuries, suicidal thoughts and attempts, and risky behaviour.
tgt_text: ku tirhisiwa ka byala hi majaha na vanhwana swi fambelanisiwa na ku kavanyeta matirhelo, ku papalata ku dyondza, ku vaviseka ko fambelana na byala, miehleketo yo tisunga no ringeta, na matikhomelo ya khombo.

src_text: we must come together to combat this vice that is robbing our young people of the best years of their lives, and making them susceptible to alcohol addiction.
tgt_text: hi fanele ku hlangana ku lwisana ni vubihi lebyi vutleleka vantshwa va hina malembe ya vona yo tsakisa ya vutomi, no va endla leswaku va va mahlonga ya xihoko.

src_text: as families it means having open and frank conversations about alcohol and setting boundaries.
tgt_text: tanihi mindyangu swi vula leswaku hi fanele ku va na mimbhurisano yo pfuleka no tshembeka mayelana na byala no veka mindzilikano.

src_text: children under the age of 18 consuming alcohol is against the law.
tgt_text: a swi le nawini eka vana lava nga ehansi ka malembe ya 18 ku nwa xihoko.

src_text: as adults we should refrain from practices such as sending minors to buy alcohol for us or capitulating to requests to buy these young people alcohol.
tgt_text: tanihi vatswatsi hi fanele ku papalata swiendlo swo fana na ku rhuma vana vatsanana ku ya hi xavela xihoko kumbe ku tinyiketela ku xavela vantshwa lava xihoko.

src_text: it is not the first time we have been confronted with tragic events such as what happened in scenery park last week.
tgt_text: a hi ro sungula hi hlangana ni khombo ro tani ro fana na leswi humeleke escenery park vhiki leri hundzeke.

src_text: a common denominator between enyobeni tavern, the throb nightclub disaster in durban in 2000, and the osi’s tavern tragedy in khayelitsha in 2015, is that these establishments were selling liquor to minors.
tgt_text: vuxaka bya swivangelo exikarhi ka thavene ya le enyobeni, khombo ra le ka ndhawu ya vatswatsi yo hungasela kona nivusiku ya throb edurban hi 2000, na khombo ra le thavenini ya osi ekhayelitsha hi 2015, hileswaku swisimekiwa leswi a swi xavisela vana lavantsongo xihoko.

src_text: the proliferation of establishments openly flouting the law points to failings on the part of authorities to enforce regulations.
tgt_text: ntlakuko wa le henhla wa swisimekiwa leswi tlulaka nawu i xikombiso xo hluleka ka nawu eka xiave xo tiyisa malawulelo.

src_text: under the national liquor act, owners of establishments with liquor licenses may not sell alcohol to anyone under the age of 18. they must also take reasonable steps to ensure anyone they are selling alcohol to is of age.
tgt_text: ehansi ka nawu wa tiko wa xihoko, vinyi va swisimekiwa leswi nga na maphepha yo xavisa xihoko a va fanelanga ku xavisela un’wana na un’wana loyi a nga ehansi ka malembe ya 18 xihoko.

src_text: we call on communities to work with authorities to ensure that taverns, shebeens, entertainment venues and outlets breaking the law face the consequences.
tgt_text: va fanele ku teka magoza yo twisiseka ku tiyisisa leswaku un’wani na un’wani loyi va n’wi xaviselaka xihoko u na malembe lama nga ringanela.

src_text: we call upon our police to step up the enforcement of laws that prohibit the sale of alcohol close to schools and enhance monitoring of outlets to ensure alcohol is not being sold to minors.
tgt_text: hi kombela miganga ku tirha na nawu ku tiyisisa leswaku tithavhene, ndhawu yo xavisela byala yo ka yi nga ri enawini, tindhawu ta vuhangasi na vaxavisi lava tlulaka nawu swi fanele ku kuma nxupulo.

src_text: another reality is that alcohol is a form of escapism for young people in communities were opportunities for safe and ageappropriate recreation are few.
tgt_text: hi vitana maphorisa ya hina ku nghenelela ku tiyisa nawu lowu alelanaka na ku xavisa xihoko ekusuhi na swikolo no engetela ku languta vaxavisi va xihoko ku tiyisisa leswaku xihoko a xi le ku xaviseriweni ka vana lavantsongo.

src_text: the scenery park community has pointed to the lack of sports, learning and other developmental facilities for young people, leading them to resort to ‘tavern hopping’.
tgt_text: ntiyiso wun’wani hileswaku xihoko i xin’wana xa swibalekelo eka vantshwa emigangeni laha swivandlanene swo hlayiseka na tindhawu ta mitlangu ya malembe ya vona ti nga titsongo.

src_text: in the wake of the tragedy, the community has pointed out that there are no viable sports grounds, community libraries or youth centres in scenery park.
tgt_text: muganga wa scenery park wu kombisile nkayivelo wa mitlangu, dyondzo na switirhisiwa swin’wani swa nhluvuko eka vantshwa, leswi endlaka leswaku va tinghenelerisa swinene eka ‘ku jikajikela ethavenini’.

src_text: as government at national, provincial and local level we need to respond to the pleas of this community and those of other communities by developing more recreational spaces, facilities, programmes, and projects for our young people in disadvantaged areas in the province.
tgt_text: ekuhumeleleni ka khombo, muganga wu humesele ehandle leswaku a ku na timbala ta mitlangu, tilayiburari ta miganga kumbe tisenthara ta vatshwa escenery park.

src_text: other social partners such as the business community should also assist with sponsorship.
tgt_text: tanihi mfumo wa tiko, xifundzakulu na miganga hi fanele ku hlamula xikombelo xa muganga lowu na yin’wana miganga hi ku ndlandlamuxa tindhawu ta vuhungaselo to tala, switirhisiwa, tiphurogireme, na tiphurojeke ta vantshwa va hina etindhawini leti sweleke exifundzeninkulu.

src_text: as communities we must work with our community policing forums, with our civics organisations and with our school governing bodies and play a more active role in the lives of our children and in ensuring their safety and wellbeing.
tgt_text: vatirhisanikulobye va vuhungasi tanihi mabindzu ya miganga ya fanele ku pfuna hi nseketelo.

src_text: as they say in our african indigenous classics "it takes a community to raise a child".
tgt_text: tanihi miganga hi fanele ku tirha na tiforamu ta maphorisa ya miganga, na mihlangano ya miganga na tihuvo ta vufambisi bya swikolo no tlanga xiave xo vonaka evuton’wini bya vana va hina no tiyisisa vuhlayiseki bya vona na rihanyu lerinene.

src_text: let us work together to protect our precious future generation from the ravages of alcohol and drug abuse and their effects.
tgt_text: tanihiloko va vula hi ndhavuko wa xiafrika "swi dinga muganga ku kurisa n’wana".

src_text: let us work together to ensure that those who put profit before the lives of our children are not allowed to operate.
tgt_text: a hi tirheni swin’we ku sirhelela vumundzuku bya kahle bya vana va hina eka ku hlakatiwa hi xihoko na swidzidziharisi na khombo ra swona.

src_text: let us also set a positive example in our own relationship with alcohol.
tgt_text: a hi tirheni swin’we ku tiyisisa leswaku vanhu lava rhangisaka bindzulo ku tlula vutomi bya vana va hina a va pfumeleriwi ku xavisa.

src_text: let us be keepers of not just our own children, but our neighbours’ children as well.
tgt_text: tiko ra hina ri rilela vutomi bya vantshwa lebyi lahlekeke eka khombo ra le thavhenini ya le enyobeni vukuzenzele unnamed mavhiki mangarimangani lama hundzeke mindyangu ya le ndhawini ya scenery park ehandle ka east london, yi kumile mahungu lama mutswari un’wana na un’wana a khongelaka ku ka a nga pfuki a ma twile.
